Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Document AI - US Remote
Description: DescriptionHere at Hugging Face, we‚Äôre on a journey to advance good Machine Learning and make it more accessible. Along the way, we contribute to the development of technology for the better.We have built the fastest-growing, open-source, library of pre-trained models in the world. With over 100M+ installs and 76K+ stars on GitHub, over 10 thousand companies are using HF technology in production, including leading AI organizations such as Google, Elastic, Salesforce, Algolia, and Grammarly.About The RoleAs a ML Engineer, you will work to improve the open-source accessibility of Document AI models and datasets. You will work towards creating datasets and training models from scratch, reproducing and building on top of the state-of-the-art Document AI techniques, in an effort to broaden open-source use cases and increase the availability of models with permissive licenses. You will get to work with a number of open-source tools, including but not limited to: Transformers, Datasets, TIMM, Diffusers, OpenCLIP, and others. You‚Äôll be working primarily with PyTorch, and may eventually work on clusters as you scale small experiments to larger ones.You'll get to foster one of the most active machine learning communities, and interact with Researchers, ML practitioners and data scientists on a daily basis through GitHub, our forums, or Slack.About YouYou have a passion for open-source, are passionate about making complex technology more accessible, and want to contribute to one of the fastest-growing ML ecosystems.Some of our requirements for this role:Experience working with multi-modal/document AI transformer modelsExperience building and training models from scratch, working through hyperparameter tuning, debugging training performance and stability issuesExperience curating, improving, and debugging issues with large image and/or text datasetsExperience running experiments via slurm jobs/clusters.If you're interested in joining us, but don't tick every box above, we still encourage you to apply! We're building a diverse team whose skills, experiences, and background complement one another. We're happy to consider where you can make the biggest impact.More About Hugging FaceWe are actively working to build a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusivity. We are intentionally building a workplace where people feel respected and supported‚Äîregardless of who you are or where you come from. We believe this is foundational to building a great company and community. Hugging Face is an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.We value development. You will work with some of the smartest people in our industry. We are an organization that has a bias for impact and is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.We care about your well-being. We offer flexible working hours and remote options. We offer health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We also offer 12 weeks of parental leave (20 for birthing mothers) and unlimited paid time off.We support our employees wherever they are. While we have office spaces in NYC and Paris, we're very distributed and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices. If needed, we'll also outfit your workstation to ensure you succeed.We want our teammates to be shareholders. All employees have company equity as part of their compensation package. If we succeed in becoming a category-defining platform in machine learning and artificial intelligence, everyone enjoys the upside.We support the community. We believe major scientific advancements are the result of collaboration across the field. Join a community supporting the ML/AI community.

Title: AI Engineer
Description: About VORTODescriptionWe are building software which enables businesses to be more economically and environmentally sustainable by digitally transforming the supply chain. As an AI Engineer at VORTO you will define the frontier of logistics optimization, supply prediction, and demand prediction.About The RoleAre you willing to give up a significant part of your personal life to commit to a startup company in downtown Denver, CO? Are you prepared to work with a strong software engineering team that is dedicated to disrupting the status quo? Are you looking for a challenge that will leave you feeling fulfilled? If yes, our AI Software Engineer role is perfect for you!Every member of the VORTO team is laser-focused on innovating on behalf of our customers. This position is highly entrepreneurial in nature, hence it requires candidates who can develop a full picture of the business problem to ship end-to-end solutions.This role is roughly 80% software engineering and 20% data science. You will work with Go, TensorFlow, PostgreSQL and various Google Cloud Platform tools to develop ‚Äúthe brain‚Äù of the platform. Specifically, you will:Solve problems using mechanistic, bottom-up thinking and statistical, top-down approachesDevelop novel mechanisms by which to optimize supply chainBuild and improve the intelligence behind our logistics simulations and market optimization algorithms Implement and ship models to predict the demand for commodities at nodes in a logistics network, the availability of supply, estimated arrival times, delays and moreRequirementsHere are some qualifications we look for:Ability to design and implement AI tools in GoExperience in at least one ML framework, such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.Experience building solutions involving algorithms, optimization, reinforcement learning, artificial neural networks, discrete event simulation and case based reasoningAbility to execute with little oversight and to solve problems quicklyExperience with function/path optimization and some of the more common algorithms ‚Äì linear programming, BOBYQA, A* Search, simulated annealingAdvanced degree in a quantitative fieldCompensation: $120-150kBenefitsAt VORTO we are committed to developing our employees and providing them exciting opportunities to grow and prosper in their careers. We encourage you to visit our careers page and read this blog post to learn more about our culture.We offer a competitive benefits package as well as numerous additional perks including:Competitive compensation packageHealth, Dental and Vision Insurance401k with matchingCompany paid life and short-term disability insuranceCompany paid parking or transit passRelocation offered when applicableModern office space in downtown DenverDaily coffee, tea, drinks & snacksTeam happy hoursVORTO is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned.

Title: Data Scientist
Industries: Technology, Information and Internet, Manufacturing, and Retail Art Supplies
Description: This position can be based out of either our Calabasas, CA office, or our San Diego, CA office.Company Vision & OverviewPlanetArt‚Äôs vision is to be the leading seller of personalized and make-on-demand products worldwide. We provide consumers with unmatched tools and content and an unparalleled end-to-end customer experience that result in high-quality, meaningful finished products and memorable celebrations of life events. The company‚Äôs brands include the popular FreePrints and FreePrints Photobooks apps and the industry leading Simply to Impress card and stationery site, as well as Personal Creations and CafePress. Visit www.planetart.com to learn more about our brands. We are distributed across multiple offices with more than 500 employees, primarily in Calabasas (Southern California), San Diego, Woodridge (Chicago) and Pleasanton (Bay Area). We also have team members in two company-owned offices in China, as well as in Europe.  Job OverviewWe are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist to join our team to work primarily in the area of customer-facing internal site search. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of experience in the field of data and site search and will be well-versed in the concepts of product management, statistical and human-centered approaches to search engine improvement, measuring search metrics, A/B testing, data cleaning, and KPI dashboards. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data-driven strategies to improve the accuracy and relevance of our internal site search results. This will involve analyzing data to understand user behavior and search patterns and using that information to optimize search algorithms and ranking models. You should have strong problem-solving skills and be able to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team. You should also have excellent communication skills, as you will be working closely with cross-functional teams to gather insights and feedback from users and presenting findings and recommendations to stakeholders. Responsibilities Analyze data to understand user behavior and search patterns, and use that information to optimize search algorithms and ranking modelsIdentify gaps in the available data and work with product and development to improve availability of important dataCollaborate with cross-functional teams to gather insights and feedback from users, and use that information to improve the search experienceDesign and implement A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of different search strategiesPresent findings and recommendations to stakeholdersStay up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in the field of data and site search Requirements Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g. Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics)3-5 years of experience in the field of data and site searchProficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQLExperience with data visualization and analysis tools such as Tableau and ExcelStrong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a teamExcellent communication skillsFamiliarity with the principles of statistical and human-centered approaches to search engine improvement, measuring search metrics, and A/B testing is a plus BenefitsPlanetArt offers a comprehensive benefits package including: Health, Dental, Vision InsuranceLife Insurance401(k) with matchingExcellent Work/Life Balance - Paid Time Off, Sick Days, Paid Holidays, and Floating HolidaysHybrid Office/Home-Work ScheduleEmployee Product Discounts

Description: WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:1/3 of Personal development1/3 of Collective Intelligence1/3 of IntrapreneurshipBonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues¬†üòÄWHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?As Blanche, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Summary We are looking for engineers with passion for using machine learning to create intelligent applications in manufacturing. Be part of a highly accomplished, deeply technical and close-knit team of machine learning engineers, you will create tools that are used by millions of people. You will design and implement machine learning solutions, and collaborate with the most innovative manufacturing design teams in the world. In this role, you also have the opportunity to work in tandem with renowned designers and engage with exciting new-product teams around Apple, and use your machine learning skills to tackle challenging technical problems in our next generation products. Key Qualifications -  Experienced in building, deploying and running Machine Learning applications or services-  Experience working with large scale of data, familiar with data processing framework like Spark-  Strong software development skills with proficiency in Python / C++-  Hands-on experience using deep learning toolkits such as PyTorch or TensorFlow/JAX-  Deep technical skills in machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, or artificial intelligence-  A real passion for making simple, robust, and scalable platforms used by other engineering teams-  Excellent problem solving and debugging skills-  Creative, collaborative and product focused-  Strong written and verbal communication skillsHAVING ONE OR MORE QUALIFICATIONS BELOW IS A PLUS:-  Experiences in hardware related tasks (e.g. defect inspection, material design, process optimization, computational display/camera etc.) or related education background (e.g. Computational Science, Integrated Engineering, Process Engineering etc.) -  Track record of adopting ML to cross-disciplinary problems-  Proficiency in other programming languages, e.g. C++, Swift, MATLAB -  Experience with CAE tools, e.g. SPICE, Abaqus, Zemax etc.. You bring a strong hands-on mentality that enables you to own engineering projects from inception to shipping product. You will also be a trusted advisor for machine learning development. Education & Experience Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related technical field, with 2+ years of experience in machine learning research or development. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Role Number: 200435069

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: We‚Äôre growing fast and looking for a driven and dedicated Machine Learning Engineer to join our team enabling next-generation automation!Join the Osaro Team:OSARO offers robotic solutions powered by machine learning, specifically for picking and placing tasks in distribution centers and factories. The company is known for having the most powerful machine vision technology for robotic piece-picking, which has been verified by the world‚Äôs top retailers, system integrators, robot manufacturers, and 3PLs. OSARO has validated its solutions with the most sophisticated robotic piece-picking deployments in the market, including for grocery distribution and cosmetics use cases, where key challenges include a) high SKU inventories, b) varying, complex packaging types, and c) fragile items requiring delicate handling. The company is the only full-stack robotics company to also offer a vision-only solution. To learn more please visit: https://osaro.com Position Responsibilities:They are searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to help manage and improve the data collection and model training pipeline used to train their AI software. Their products combine state-of-the-art perception algorithms and adaptive decision-making abilities with sophisticated control algorithms to endow industrial robots with the autonomy needed to perform efficiently at scale in several industrial applications.As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work closely with the machine learning team to automate, manage, and validate the data collection pipelines and procedures. You will also be responsible for monitoring, training, and validating performance of their deep learning perception models. They value candidates who are passionate about what they build, feel a strong sense of ownership over their work, and love being continually challenged. The ideal candidates are those who care deeply about their team and demonstrate both directness and integrity.This role includes:Working with the machine learning team to automate, manage, and validate their data collection pipelines and processesTraining, monitoring, and validating their deep learning perception modelsVisualizing, debugging, and diagnosing data integrity issuesExecuting hands on machine learning with TensorFlow, Keras, deep learning concepts and popular models/architectures, tools, and techniquesBuilding ML pipelines, product features, tooling for visualization and diagnosing ML models, tooling for data analytics, and contributing to production quality softwareCollecting, organizing, and presenting performance results to stakeholdersApplying best practices in data science to help the team draw actionable conclusions from data and performance resultsQualifications:B.S. or higher degree in computer science or related engineering fieldExcellent Python programming skillsExperience with TensorFlow or a similar deep learning frameworkKnowledge of key concepts in machine learning (particularly deep learning) and data science Familiarity with big data and databases (BigQuery)Strong ethic of self-reliance and the initiative to do whatever is needed to solve a problemStrong communication skills and a proven ability to deliver under aggressive schedulesLegal authorization to work in the U.S. is required (we do sponsor H1B transfer)Our Dream Teammate will be:Strong theoretical knowledge and practical experience with classical machine learning and deep learning techniquesExperience with 3D scene understanding and object detection/segmentation from visionExperience with robotic manipulation hardware: arms, 3D cameras, force sensorsExperience working independently on large, shared code bases and infrastructureExperience with big data processing tools: Spark/Hive/BigQuery etc.Location: San Francisco Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $160,000.00 - $180,000.00

Description: Scismic is supporting the growth of an an early-stage biotech company focused on creating and commercializing scalable solutions for storage and single cell genomic analysis of precious clinical samples based out of Waltham, MA!Position SummaryThey are seeking a candidate with excellent single cell computational and data analysis skills and a high aptitude for applications and technologies for single-cell genomics. This candidate will work on-site and participate in computational and secondary analysis assignments to uncover features from datasets that will inform on product improvements, technical troubleshooting, and detection of biological signals from customers, collaborators, and internal projects. The candidate will play a role in the development, optimization, validation, and support of products and protocols. Specific responsibilities will include: (1) bioinformatics processing and analysis of single-cell datasets; (2) participating in the development and support of analysis pipelines and customer-facing software; (3) analysis of experiments and projects that develop, test, and optimize molecular biology workflows; and (4) perform root cause analysis and troubleshooting support of customer applications and data.Responsibilities & Essential FunctionsExamine single cell datasets (secondary analysis) to detect signals associated with technology performance or collaborator projectsParticipate in feature improvements, bug-fixing, and deployment of their software and pipelinesCommunicate results to management and core team membersSummarize studies and results in whitepapers and/or presentationsImplement basic statistics principles and quantitative reasoning for data analysis and experimental designExpand and refine computational pipelines for streamlined performanceProvide bioinformatics-related customer support and troubleshooting as part of a larger support teamSupport innovation and IP creationAdhere to quality system requirements and safety complianceQualificationsPhD training in Biology, Immunology, Bioinformatics, or related discipline or equivalent work experience, or related fieldDemonstrated single-cell informatics software and pipeline experienceFamiliarity in UNIX/Linux environmentsExperience with single-cell analysis software (e.g. Seurat, Scanpy) and the ability to analyze data for quality and biological meaningAbility to quickly learn about new science and technology fieldsComfortable in fast-paced and dynamic environment of an early-stage companyAptitude for creative problem-solving and excellent troubleshooting skillsExcellent organization and task planning skillsGood communication, interpersonal and teamwork skillsAuthorization to work in the United States without sponsorship

Title: Data Scientist
Description: GlobalData is a world leading provider of data and analysis for Consumer, Technology, and Healthcare businesses. With offices in all major markets, we work with global brands delivering unique data and insight to enable informed business decisions, through a range of research services. These include online Intelligence Centres, reports, and consultancy services. We have over 40 years‚Äô corporate experience with expertise in market planning and development, innovation and new product development, customer acquisition, competitive intelligence, and strategic planning.GlobalData Consumer is the only data and analytics provider in this sector to cover the entire value chain from suppliers, manufacturers and distribution channels to trends and insights on consumer behaviour and market trends. GlobalData Consumer has a long-held reputation for providing valuable and in- depth market research initially built up in beverages, and now operates across the FMCG market and related industries, including packaging, ingredients, soft drinks, beer, retail, foodservice, wines & spirits, cosmetics & toiletries and food.Building on our 40 years of experience as the leading market research and analysis provider to the beverage industry, we have continually enhanced and refined our specialist research skills and market intelligence tools. We specialise in conducting online survey panels, producing in-depth market insights reports through qualitative and quantitative in-country analysis as well as offering clients a bespoke consultancy service tailored to address each client‚Äôs specific business needs.Know more about us: https://www.globaldata.com/Follow us on LinkedIn for more updates: https://www.linkedin.com/company/gd-research-center-pvt-ltdROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIESGlobalData's Custom Solutions group is integral to the success of GlobalData by enabling our clients to gain greater insight and value from our knowledge and data sets. The team engages with some of the most senior clients to build a greater understanding of how GlobalData‚Äôs insights impact them. Our core offerings include opportunity identification, competitor intelligence, sales enablement, market deep dives and due diligence support.Recently consolidated into a standalone division, Custom Solutions is growing strongly and is now looking to transform its delivery organisation.The data scientist will be a part of data science activities in the Consulting group, utilising Excel(and Python) to deliver bespoke projects for our clients. A key part of the role will be developing both new and current systems. Typical projects include:¬∑ Bayesian forecasting¬∑ Regression and Classification models¬∑ Price elasticity models¬∑ Factor and cluster analysis¬∑ Decision tree analysis¬∑ Data modelling¬∑ Market entry analysis¬∑ Dashboard visualization (advantageous but not essential)The data scientist will be also be involved in and advise on project requirements, scoping and execution. They will communicate extensively with internal stakeholders and there are also opportunities for a client facing aspect, pitching work, and presenting findings from projects.JOB QUALIFICATIONS3+ year work experienceStrong Excel experience for Creating excel modelsexperience in Python programming and familiarity with most common DS libraries (pandas, scikit-learn) and the ability to write modularized code (advantageous but not essential)VBA knowledge is a bonusData modelling and Data manipulation experienceEducated to degree levelCommitment to D&I and EEO :We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, GlobalData is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. GlobalData is determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favorable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Detroit, MI, USA Req #1679Wednesday, October 6, 2021Company Overview And CultureEXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Bringing together deep domain expertise with robust data, powerful analytics, cloud, and AI, we create agile, scalable solutions and execute complex operations for the world‚Äôs leading corporations in industries including insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, media, and retail, among others. Focused on creating value from data for driving faster decision-making and transforming operating models, EXL was founded on the core values of innovation, collaboration, excellence, integrity and respect. Headquartered in New York, our team is over 40,000 strong, with more than 50 offices spanning six continents. For information, visit www.exlservice.com .For the past 20 years, EXL has worked as a strategic partner and won awards in its approach to helping its clients solve business challenges such as digital transformation, improving customer experience, streamlining business operations, taking products to market faster, improving corporate finance, building models to become compliant more quickly with new regulations, turning volumes of data into business opportunities, creating new channels for growth and better adapting to change. The business operates within four business units: Insurance, Health, Analytics, and Emerging businesses.EXL looks deeper. Deeper into your business to find smarter solutions and clearer strategies for a better business model. We believe that businesses must look deeper at how they manage their operations and processes to better handle change and sustain growth. Our responsibility, as a dedicated partner, is to take a problem-solving focus, ask the right questions, and create the right solutions to make sure our clients‚Äô needs are met. EXL is business process solutions company. We integrate operations management services, decision analytics and technology platforms to deliver immediate results and long-term business impact. We work as a strategic partner to help our clients simplify and streamline business operations, improve corporate finance, manage compliance, create new channels for growth, and better adapt to change.EXL Analytics provides data-driven, action-oriented solutions to business problems through statistical data mining, cutting edge analytics and data science techniques and a consultative approach. Leveraging proprietary methodology and best-of-breed technology, EXL Analytics takes an industry-specific approach to transform our clients‚Äô decision making and embed analytics more deeply into their business processes. Our global footprint of nearly 2,000 data scientists and analysts assist client organizations with complex risk minimization methods, advanced marketing, pricing and CRM strategies, internal cost analysis, and cost and resource optimization within the organization. EXL Analytics serves the insurance, healthcare, banking, capital markets, utilities, retail and e-commerce, travel, transportation and logistics industries.Responsibilities Create end to end ML workflow, training pipelines, engineer new features, monitor training process, unit testing  Coding and architecting of end-to-end applications on modern data processing technology stack: Hadoop, Hive, AWS Cloud, Spark ecosystem technologies  Work on analytics application infrastructure analysis & requirements (e.g., configuration, access, tools, services, computing capacity, etc.)  Test components of the pipeline and deploy them into a target environment  Enable sharing models and collaboration to improve model management with a model registry  Define model serving options, create testing pipeline in production  Enable model monitoring for detection of anomalies, early alerts, and triggering ML pipelines for retraining  Unify all the processes and automate entire release process with CI/CD orchestration Qualifications Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas; candidates with BA/BS degrees in the same fields from the top tier academic institutions are also welcome to apply  Min 4 years of Big Data, and Spark experience building and running complex pipelines/applications at scale in production  Min 2 year hands-on experience implementing or prototyping machine learning systems, preferably in Python or other similar object-oriented programming languages  Experience with AWS: S3, Airflow, EC2, Sagemaker, Lambda, ECR, Spark, Kafka, Kinesis, DynamoDB  Industry best practices in coding is a must (Using Git)  Strong background in machine learning, optimization and scaling ML algorithms  Care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation.  Firm grasp of CS fundamentals, Data structures, and algorithms  Experience and passion for fostering collaborative teams.  Demonstrated leadership ability and willingness to take initiative  Strong record of achievement, solid analytical ability, and an entrepreneurial hands-on approach to work  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills What We Offer EXL Analytics offers an exciting, fast-paced and innovative environment, which brings together a group of sharp and entrepreneurial professionals who are eager to influence business decisions.  The ability to learn aspects of client businesses, effective teamwork and time-management skills and a deeper understanding of statistics and machine learning  We invest heavily in training you in all aspects of analytics as well as in leading analytical tools and techniques.  A talented and experienced pool of mentors and advisors EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/DisabilitiesPlease be aware that EXL requires all employees to be vaccinated for COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to obtain and show proof of a vaccination. EXL is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law. Base Salary Range Disclaimer:  The base salary range represents the low and high end of the EXL base salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to: location and experience. The base salary range listed is just one component of EXL's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, as well as a Paid Time Off policy, and many region specific benefits.Please also note that the data shared through the job application will be stored and processed by EXL in accordance with the EXL Privacy Policy.Other Details Pay Type Salary Apply Now

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: At MNTN, we've built a culture based on quality, trust, ambition, and accountability ‚Äì but most importantly, we really enjoy working here. We pride ourselves on our self-service platform, originally coded by our President and CEO, and are constantly seeking to improve the user experience for our customers and scale for efficiency. Our startup spirit powers our growth mindset and supports our teammates as they build the future of ConnectedTV. We're looking for people who naturally want to do more, own more, and make an impact in their careers ‚Äì and we're seeking someone to be part of our next stage of growth.As a Machine Learning Engineer on our Attribution team, you will ideate, train, test, deploy, evaluate and monitor matching systems in a large scale production environment to maximize advertiser goals while respecting consumer privacy. As a core contributor to how we best match ads, you will work with data science, software engineers, product managers, infrastructure teams, and data teams. Relevant experience includes propensity modeling, ranking, predictive modeling, spam detection, clustering, segmentation, and similar.What You'll Do:Use MNTN proprietary and third party data sources to conceive and lead machine learning projects that maximize goals for advertising marketers while protecting consumer privacy. Be a hands-on builder of needed components in software and infrastructure. Become the end to end expert on matching ad opportunities to potential audiences in an ambiguous and privacy-focused ecosphere. Identify opportunities and gaps in data and insights for both internal and external stakeholders. Work with product and engineering teams to create and evaluate your model designs. Lead discussions with other technical and non-technical functions. Investigate critical incidents and provide insights to data ambiguity. What You'll Bring:3+ years of experience of real-world problem solving related to developing and using machine learning models on large scale data. Advanced degrees in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or similar may be substituted for some years of experience. Experience in SQL, Python, Spark, R, or similar languages. Experience in machine learning libraries and platforms such as scikit-learn, tensorflow, sagemaker, or similar. Written and verbal communication skills to convey complex technical topics to a variety of audiences. MNTN Perks100% remote Open-ended vacation policy with an annual vacation allowanceThree-day weekend every month of the yearCompetitive compensation100% healthcare coverage401k planFlexible Spending Account (FSA) for dependent, medical, and dental careAccess to coaching, therapy, and professional developmentAbout MNTN:MNTN provides advertising software for brands to reach their audience across Connected TV, web, and mobile. MNTN Performance TV has redefined what it means to advertise on television, transforming Connected TV into a direct-response, performance marketing channel. Our web retargeting has been leveraged by thousands of top brands for over a decade, driving billions of dollars in revenue.Our solutions give advertisers total transparency and complete control over their campaigns ‚Äì all with the fastest go-live in the industry. As a result, thousands of top brands have partnered with MNTN, including, Petsmart, Build with Ferguson Master, Simplisafe, Yieldstreet and National University.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Connecticut, USADetroit, MI, USANew York, NY, USA Req #1679Monday, November 1, 2021Company Overview And CultureEXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Bringing together deep domain expertise with robust data, powerful analytics, cloud, and AI, we create agile, scalable solutions and execute complex operations for the world‚Äôs leading corporations in industries including insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, media, and retail, among others. Focused on creating value from data for driving faster decision-making and transforming operating models, EXL was founded on the core values of innovation, collaboration, excellence, integrity and respect. Headquartered in New York, our team is over 40,000 strong, with more than 50 offices spanning six continents. For information, visit www.exlservice.com .For the past 20 years, EXL has worked as a strategic partner and won awards in its approach to helping its clients solve business challenges such as digital transformation, improving customer experience, streamlining business operations, taking products to market faster, improving corporate finance, building models to become compliant more quickly with new regulations, turning volumes of data into business opportunities, creating new channels for growth and better adapting to change. The business operates within four business units: Insurance, Health, Analytics, and Emerging businesses.EXL looks deeper. Deeper into your business to find smarter solutions and clearer strategies for a better business model. We believe that businesses must look deeper at how they manage their operations and processes to better handle change and sustain growth. Our responsibility, as a dedicated partner, is to take a problem-solving focus, ask the right questions, and create the right solutions to make sure our clients‚Äô needs are met. EXL is business process solutions company. We integrate operations management services, decision analytics and technology platforms to deliver immediate results and long-term business impact. We work as a strategic partner to help our clients simplify and streamline business operations, improve corporate finance, manage compliance, create new channels for growth, and better adapt to change.EXL Analytics provides data-driven, action-oriented solutions to business problems through statistical data mining, cutting edge analytics and data science techniques and a consultative approach. Leveraging proprietary methodology and best-of-breed technology, EXL Analytics takes an industry-specific approach to transform our clients‚Äô decision making and embed analytics more deeply into their business processes. Our global footprint of nearly 2,000 data scientists and analysts assist client organizations with complex risk minimization methods, advanced marketing, pricing and CRM strategies, internal cost analysis, and cost and resource optimization within the organization. EXL Analytics serves the insurance, healthcare, banking, capital markets, utilities, retail and e-commerce, travel, transportation and logistics industries.Responsibilities Create end to end ML workflow, training pipelines, engineer new features, monitor training process, unit testing  Coding and architecting of end-to-end applications on modern data processing technology stack: Hadoop, Hive, AWS Cloud, Spark ecosystem technologies  Work on analytics application infrastructure analysis & requirements (e.g., configuration, access, tools, services, computing capacity, etc.)  Test components of the pipeline and deploy them into a target environment  Enable sharing models and collaboration to improve model management with a model registry  Define model serving options, create testing pipeline in production  Enable model monitoring for detection of anomalies, early alerts, and triggering ML pipelines for retraining  Unify all the processes and automate entire release process with CI/CD orchestration Qualifications Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas; candidates with BA/BS degrees in the same fields from the top tier academic institutions are also welcome to apply  Min 4 years of Big Data, and Spark experience building and running complex pipelines/applications at scale in production  Min 2 year hands-on experience implementing or prototyping machine learning systems, preferably in Python or other similar object-oriented programming languages  Experience with AWS: S3, Airflow, EC2, Sagemaker, Lambda, ECR, Spark, Kafka, Kinesis, DynamoDB  Industry best practices in coding is a must (Using Git)  Strong background in machine learning, optimization and scaling ML algorithms  Care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation.  Firm grasp of CS fundamentals, Data structures, and algorithms  Experience and passion for fostering collaborative teams.  Demonstrated leadership ability and willingness to take initiative  Strong record of achievement, solid analytical ability, and an entrepreneurial hands-on approach to work  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills What We Offer EXL Analytics offers an exciting, fast-paced and innovative environment, which brings together a group of sharp and entrepreneurial professionals who are eager to influence business decisions.  The ability to learn aspects of client businesses, effective teamwork and time-management skills and a deeper understanding of statistics and machine learning  We invest heavily in training you in all aspects of analytics as well as in leading analytical tools and techniques.  A talented and experienced pool of mentors and advisors EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/DisabilitiesPlease be aware that EXL requires all employees to be vaccinated for COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to obtain and show proof of a vaccination. EXL is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law. Base Salary Range Disclaimer:  The base salary range represents the low and high end of the EXL base salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to: location and experience. The base salary range listed is just one component of EXL's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, as well as a Paid Time Off policy, and many region specific benefits.Please also note that the data shared through the job application will be stored and processed by EXL in accordance with the EXL Privacy Policy.Other Details Pay Type Salary Apply Now

Title: Machine Learning Solutions Engineer
Description: OverviewRoboflow is the fastest way to use computer vision in production. Over 100k engineers build with our tools. Helping our users get the most out of Roboflow is essential to their success.We‚Äôre hiring our second Solutions Engineer to partner closely with our sales team and drive new customer wins. You‚Äôll have an immense impact on shaping the future of not only this role, but our company. A large portion of the Roboflow sales process is technical, ensuring customers understand how to incorporate computer vision into their products. Building successful relationships with our potential customers -- many of whom are engineers -- as well as showcasing what the Roboflow product is capable of is a key component of the role, so you will leverage both your engineering background and user-facing mindset to be successful.What You‚Äôll DoBecause our customers use computer vision in so many different industries (accelerating cancer research, improving manufacturing processes, enabling automated checkout, and so much more), your workday will always include an engaging variety of challenges. You will work with sales on delivering demos, building proofs of concepts and prototypes with prospects, and in answering technical questions, assisting in closing deals. You will use your knowledge gathered through sales motions and work with our Customer Success team to determine ways to best drive adoption and successful implementations of computer vision within their products. You will also contribute to the post-sales process (Customer Engineering) in an engineering capacity to ensure our customers are successful throughout their journey with Roboflow. We don‚Äôt just stop at signature and onboarding. We want our customers to be life long partners with Roboflow and ensure they are receiving the ROI they envisioned when they first signed on. If you think, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm an engineer that loves sharing my work with others,‚Äù you‚Äôd be in great company in this role.Who You‚Äôll Work WithAs an early first Machine Learning Solutions engineer hire, you‚Äôll be partnering directly with our co-founder/CEO, Sales leadership and Customer Success leadership to not only do great work in the role, but shape how this function works for the future of Roboflow.In This Role, You‚ÄôllSupport Sales team to assess technical fitDemo Roboflow to potential customers, answer questions about Roboflow, ultimately convincing them Roboflow is the correct solutionYou will collaborate with Sales and Engineering teams to develop POCs and propose solutions that best fit a customers needsTalk with potential customers, understand their problems, and assess Title: Data Scientist, Jr.
Description: Data ScientistAltamira delivers a variety of analytic and engineering capabilities to the US National Security community, but the tech culture and the caliber of the individuals that bring these capabilities to fruition are what really set us apart. We‚Äôre a curious, responsive, dedicated bunch spread across many corporate cultures. Dayton, OH is highly focused on the Space-based mission set with a heavy emphasis on sensor exploitation and analysis; Tampa, FL focuses on ‚Äòart-of-the-possible‚Äô analytics of all kinds with an emphasis on graph technologies, NLP, and wrangling complex data sets; and all forces converge at our headquarters in the Northern Virginia/Washington DC area where we host our tech events and support engineering and analytic missions across several IC and DOD agencies.While our work occurs in different states and different mission domains, we‚Äôve got analytics at the heart of every operation and genuine curiosity for new methods, techniques, and solutions. Our specialties are data science and analytics, data engineering, software engineering, and end-to-end analytic solutions architecture. We‚Äôve also got some awesome benefits like the Altamira Healthy Living program, with ongoing competitions and a flexible spending stipend for health and wellness-related items.Location: Ft Belvoir, NC and Camp Lejeune, NCThe Role: An Altamira Data Scientist/Analyst is an integral member of an analytic and engineering team. The data scientist is expected to participate in the design, development, and implementation of novel analytics to address a variety of customer problem sets. We are highly interested in individuals who can craft narratives around their analytics, producing highly visual representations of both the output and the innerworkings of analytic methods. The Data Scientist should be versed in statistics, predictive modeling, machine learning, computational simulation, geospatial modeling, network science, or other analytic techniques. This individual will also have a firm grasp of the environments in which the analytics must be deployed, whether stand-alone, within a broader software architecture, in the cloud, etc. While a heavy programming background is not required, sufficient technical knowledge to implement the analytics is highly desired.Your skills:Demonstrable expertise in an area of data science or analytics (e.g. machine learning, deep learning, NLP, computer vision, predictive modeling and forecasting, statistics) Ability to review academic literature, extract analytic methods, and apply them to new data sets and mission areasFamiliarity with conducting literature reviews, producing Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) of analytic methods, and exploring commercial software Working knowledge of 1 or more programming languages Experience working with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)Experience delivering analytic solutions in cloud environments (AWS strongly preferred) Ability to visually represent and communicate complex analytics is strongly desiredFamiliarity with specific sensor phenomenologies is desired (e.g. SAR & RF, OPIR, etc.) Your quals:Secret, TS, or TS/SCI clearance (TS/SCI strongly preferred)Significant coursework or professional experience in machine learning, deep learning, NLP, computer vision, predictive modeling and forecasting, statistics, or similar analytic domainBachelor‚Äôs Degree (BS) or higher in similar technical field to above Experience delivering software or technical solutions to DOD or IC customers, USAF, JAIC, NRO, NGA, or other intelligence organizations strongly desiredFamiliarity with data visualization software, tools, and techniques is desiredAltamira is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Title: Data Scientist
Description: About VendrVendr is forever changing how companies buy and renew SaaS. With over $2 billion in SaaS purchases across 2,300+ suppliers, the Vendr SaaS buying platform enables the world‚Äôs fastest-growing companies to purchase SaaS, without friction and at a fair price. Headquartered in Boston with a second location in Charleston and over 340+ employees, we are building a team that can take us to the future state of frictionless buying. Some customers include HubSpot, The Washington Post, and DraftKings.The Vendr culture is one where kindness, teamwork, mutual support, and bold initiative are encouraged. Read more about our values.In June 2022, we raised $150M in Series B funding at a $1B valuation, co-led by Craft Ventures and SoftBank with return investments from Tiger Global, Sound Ventures (Ashton Kutcher & Guy Oseary), Y Combinator, and others.Since 2018, we have:Managed $2 Billion+ in software spendSaved $304M+ for our customersGiven our customers thousands of hours back to focus on the important parts of their jobAnd we‚Äôre just getting started. This is your chance to join as we enter hyper-growth and make a massive impact, forever changing the way people buy and sell B2B SaaS.About the Role: We are looking for analytics professionals to join our Vendr Data Science and Analytics team. Our responsibilities include driving operational performance through KPIs and dashboards, as well as developing visualizations which offer relevant insights both within the Vendr products and for marketing and public relations. Data is central to Vendr‚Äôs success and your role will be directly relevant to the company value proposition.You are someone who is self-taught, passionate about getting the right answer, and has experience with data: diving in, testing hypotheses, developing visualizations, and telling relevant stories. You enjoy sharing these insights with others in the organization, and look to be challenged and grow by engaging in a small team of data professionals who are each on their own growth journey. We operate without significant silos and boundaries, and expect you to participate with flexibility and openness as part of a team which values teamwork and takes pride in individual mastery. You will be expected to develop your own positions and approaches and bring to the team recommendations on how to proceed with your work.Responsibilities:Use data to drive operational improvements including development of KPIs, targets, dashboards, and visualizations which can complement lean operational processes and improve throughput time and client value.Develop visualizations usable in product to facilitate operational teams and customer self-serviceSupport client data requests meticulously and efficiently while proactively developing systems and tools to minimize ad hoc requestsDrive self-service of data by developing data sources, enhancing data dictionaries and other contextual information, and organizing data sources and dashboards to guide users to relevant tools.Training clients and new team members in data exploration, visualization and dashboard development.Conducting analytical exercises required to support clients and stakeholders requiring customized solutions.Consult and develop concepts with operational stakeholders and product teams.Develop and maintain business operating dashboards and metrics.Identify, validate and integrate new data sources which enhance business value.Contribute to a culture of data quality, reliability and relevance.Review SaaS tools which can extend the team‚Äôs capabilities.Protect customer data proactively.Participate in team activities ranging from daily standups to roadmaps, prioritization, timelines, skill development, and occasional meetups.Requirements:2+ years experience in data analysis, statistics, or quantitative applications and developmentQuantitative and analytical skills exhibited through ability to dive deeply into data and discover patterns and relationships not captured by statistical summariesSQLExperience with python or r, visualization tools, and statisticsProblem solving skillsEnthusiasm about the hard work required to broaden your technical skill set (pandas, sklearn, visualization tools), your operational skill set (agile and lean), your knowledge of SaaS (Vendr‚Äôs domain), your business and economics skills, and your interpersonal skillsPreferred: Academic degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, social sciences, engineering, operations research, computer science or related fieldPython or R expertiseSQL expertiseData modeling experienceDbt experienceTableau and/or Looker experienceVisualization - not just ‚Äúhow to‚Äù but also ‚Äúbest practice‚ÄùStatistics (esp. Bayesian statistics)Machine learning modelsForecasting models (such as Prophet)AB TestingOpen source developmentExcel (Google sheets) pivot tablesBusiness acumenEconomics and financeStakeholder management and client communicationPassion for learningSelf-directednessWhy Vendr We‚Äôre rapidly growing, (2-3x growth YoY in ARR, 2x headcount growth YoY)We‚Äôre a disruptor, we‚Äôre changing the way saas is purchased and managedWe have the right value proposition at this time, (we save companies time and money and help them grow efficiently)We‚Äôre a startup with durable growth, (25M+ ARR, 530+ active customers, financially backed with our recent Series B raise)We have great people and a strong culture, (check out our values here)Competitive pay & benefits **applicable to U.S. employees, ask our team for details on our International benefits**Medical, Dental, Vision with company paid premiumsHSA contributionFlexible/unlimited PTO12 paid company holidays in addition to PTO4% 401k matchingWFH stipendEducation & wellness reimbursementAll Mac environmentVendr is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. While we are interested in qualified applicants who are permanently eligible to work for any employer in the United States, we are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship for employment visas at this time.To all recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

We value your integrity, hard work, and commitment to make a difference in the technical sphere. For this reason, we focus on providing end-to-end career assistance and enhancing your already existing IT skills and knowledge.Currently, we are looking for qualified entry-level Data Scientists who can apply Data Science principles to design, test, implement, and develop data-based solutions, including reporting, auditing, and preparing large databases for statistical analysis.Minimum Background And Qualifications Requirement Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, or IT  Must have Mathematics or Statistics background Technical And Soft Skills Required Experience in Python programming and understanding of the software development life cycle.  Knowledge of Linear Algebra, Statistics, and Mathematics concepts.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Highly motivated, self-learner, team player, and technically inquisitive.  Strong work ethics and creative problem-solving abilities.   Preferred skills  Deep Learning  Data visualization  NLP  Scala  Django Roles And Responsibilities Collaborate with dynamic teams of engineers, developers, and scientists who research and integrate algorithms to develop an application, software, and computer system solutions to address complex data problems.  Assess project requirements and develop data analysis algorithms.  Engage developers to share their opinions, knowledge, and recommendations to meet the deliverables.  Contribute to technical solutions and implement software analyses to unlock the secrets held by big data sets.  Integrate components like web-based UI, commercial indexing products, and access control mechanisms to create operational information and knowledge discovery systems. Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description: Met plezier mag ik jullie aandacht vragen voor deze leuke en interessante Data Science rol. Deze club telt momenteel 15 medewerkers die allemaal in het data werkveld actief zijn. Ze zitten gevestigd in Enschede, goed aan te rijden en ook goed bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Deze partij helpt verschillende klanten met het verwerken en lezen van de data. Dit alles met als doel om de data v√≥√≥r de klant te laten werken. Of het nou gaat om een voorspelmodel, procesanalyse, bouwen van dashboards of een data pipeline te maken.FunctieAls data scientist ga je hier met het team jezelf bezig houden met het verzamelen, opschonen en analyseren van de data. Dit alles om bijvoorbeeld het goed voorspelmodel te ontwikkelen en te trainen, of je gaat met de door jouw opgeschoonde data een dashboard bouwen, bijvoorbeeld in powerBI. Tevens willen zij ten alle tijden op de hoogte zijn van de nieuwste technieken en tools, hierin kan je dan ook verschillende trainingen volgen. Hier is geen vastgesteld budget voor, dit omdat zij erin geloven dat trainingen bijdragen aan jou en de organisatie. Er is een breed scala aan projecten, veel ontwikkel mogelijkheden en een enorm leuk sfeer.Op kantoor heerst er een open en informele werksfeer, iedereen kent elkaar en is ge√Ønteresseerd in elkaar. Het kantoor is trouwens nog geen jaar oud, voorzien van de nieuwe snufjes. Er is ruimte om te ontspannen, te ontmoeten en te inspireren. Dit allemaal in het hart van EnschedeEisenHeb jij: Een afgeronde HBO/WO technische opleiding Ervaring of kennis van Python, SQL, R. Kennis van datamodellering en ben je analytisch ingesteld. Zin om te werken bij deze jonge club data specialisten.AanbodDan bieden zij: Goed salaris Pensioenregeling 8% vakantiegeld Laptop en mobiel Legendarische uitjesBen jij ge√Ønteresseerd in een leuke, nieuwe uitdaging en herken jij jezelf in het bovenstaande profiel? Reageer dan snel. Dit kan per email op [email protected] Of bel mij op +31 88 321 8128.Tot snel!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: The Mission:This is a critical and exciting time at Enigma. We are hearing from repeated customers that our product is creating tremendous value for them and is aligned perfectly with their needs. This creates an urgent need to accelerate the build out of our machine learning capabilities.We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our growing team. You will play a central role in improving our entity resolution algorithms, predicting the behavior of millions of small businesses and developing our machine learning infrastructure.The Role:As a member of Machine Learning team, you will build the ML systems and infrastructure at the core of our small business data product. Your impact will be measured by the performance, testability and reliability of our ML systems.We are looking for someone who:Combines a solid grounding in statistical learning with a passion for engineering scalable, low-maintenance systemsInspires their teammates to perform at their best while building a collaborative, supportive team cultureEffectively manages responsibilities for the development and tuning of statistical models and the design and implementation of ML system at scale. Engineers best-in-class solutions for developing, testing and deploying statistical models to production environments (we use PySpark)Builds reusable frameworks and tooling that accelerate innovationWhat makes this job interesting?Technical Challenge: you will build scalable machine learning systems with low costs of ownership for a rapidly evolving productImpact: your work product will have a direct impact on hundreds of millions of significant decisions within the massive small business economyLearning: We're tackling problems with exciting data that don't have obvious solutions. Every day brings new opportunities to learnOur ideal candidate:Has 4+ years of software engineering experience with 2+ years building machine learning systems at scaleEnjoys collaborating with cross-functional partners (data scientists, data engineers and product managers) to set clear expectations and solve common problems. Is driven to work with customers to have an impact on the real worldBonus points if you:Have an outstanding track record of designing and implementing machine learning systemsHave experience working as both a software engineer and a data scientistAbout Us:At Enigma, we're building the single, most reliable source of data on businesses to power the future of financial services. By engineering better data from hundreds of public and third-party sources, we aim to tell the complete story of every business, so that companies of every size can access the financial services they need to grow and thrive. Our core values ‚Äì generosity, curiosity, ingenuity, & drive ‚Äì guide everything we do, from how we make our most important product decisions to how we work with and support one another on a daily basis. We're a team of curious, driven individuals with diverse backgrounds and skills, but we're all passionate about engineering deeper understanding through data‚Äîtogether. If this resonates, we would love to hear from you!We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.Salary Range: $160,000-$210,000A note on salary ranges: we pride ourselves on paying competitively for our size and industry. Salary is one piece of a total Enigma compensation package that includes additional benefits and opportunities. All of our compensation packages include equity because we believe 100% of Enigma employees should have the option to purchase ownership in the company and benefit from the value we're creating together.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: About The RoleAmartha is one of the biggest fintech players in Indonesia. We provide micro financing to women entrepreneurs in rural areas by connecting them with online potential lenders. We are currently looking for a data scientist to join the Amartha data team. You will have the opportunity to use state of the art big data tools and methods to process the large amount of data that we have collected. Title: Data Scientist
Description: Who We AreApixio is advancing healthcare with data-driven intelligence and analytics. Our Artificial Intelligence platform gives organizations across the healthcare spectrum the power to mine clinical information at scale, creating novel insights that will change the way healthcare is measured, care is delivered, and discoveries are made.About The RoleWe are changing the way healthcare uses data. About 80% of healthcare data is under-used because it is too messy or unstructured to analyze. The healthcare industry needs technology solutions that can process this data and extract insights. This is the challenge that Apixio addresses.Apixio augments the ability to decipher and understand patient information. This translates into better care delivery, lower costs, and streamlined processes. We process millions of patients every year and we‚Äôre growing not only in the number of patients but also the kind of data we analyze. Come help us improve healthcare with technology!We are looking for a motivated data scientist to both improve our industry leading algorithms in risk adjustment and help us evolve our product offerings into new market segments. This is a critical role where the right candidate will have the ability to lead the way in developing novel models that solve a wide range of problems in the healthcare industry. High achievers in this role have the opportunity to increase efficiency of the healthcare system, assist physicians in their practices, and touch the lives of millions of patients.QualificationsBachelor‚Äôs Degree in computer science, statistics, or a related field.2+ years of experience with data science and machine learning in an industry setting.Proficient with Python.Experience with standard data analysis toolkits such as SQL, Spark, Pandas, etc.Demonstrated ability to solve problems with machine learning models and to communicate solutions clearly and effectively to non-technical audiences.Like to focus on practically solving real business problems, not just boosting model performance curves.Strong communicator who can translate technical topics into intuitive business languageResponsibilitiesPlay a key role in the success of our products by developing novel models in multiple domains.Work with other data scientists and engineers to build end-to-end machine learning pipelines.Define key performance metrics for models according to business requirements and help implement systems to track those metrics in production.Work on long term improvements to performance of the algorithms.After 3 Months, You Will‚Ä¶Have a strong grasp of technologies upon which our platform is built.Build, test, deploy, and monitor a novel algorithm on our platform, from encrypted data to a live service.After 1 Year, You Will‚Ä¶Be independent in reading literature and doing research to design novel models for new and existing products.Have ownership over models internally, communicating with product managers, customer success managers, and engineering to make the model and the encompassing product succeed.Be a subject matter expert on Apixio‚Äôs models and a source from which other teams can seek information and recommendations.About ApixioImproving healthcare outcomes requires access to the right data at the right time. Apixio is advancing value-based care with data-driven intelligence and analytics. Our AI solutions for risk, quality, and clinical insights unlock actionable information from administrative data and unstructured clinical information. The results drive better clinical decision-making and a smarter approach to healthcare.Our success is driven by a team of experienced, passionate, and fun engineers, data scientists, and business professionals working to solve complex problems with innovative AI technologies and techniques. Over the past year, we grew our client base by 20%, serving dozens of large health plans and provider groups nationwide. We're backed by top venture capital firms such as Bain Capital and SSM Partners, and led by a seasoned team of healthcare and technology experts.The salary range below is for Base Salary. Total compensation also includes benefits and variable compensationBase Compensation$105,000‚Äî$175,000 USDWe recognize that people come with experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Your skills and background may be more translatable to this role than you initially thought. Allow us the opportunity to get to know you. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.What Apixio Can Offer YouMeaningful work to improve healthcare Competitive compensationExceptional benefits, including medical, dental and vision, FSA401k with company matchingGenerous vacation policyA hybrid work schedule (2 days in office & 3 days work from home) (Note: If the position is designated as REMOTE it will stay REMOTE)Modern open office in beautiful San Mateo, CA Los Angeles, CA & San Diego, CASubsidized gym membershipCatered, free lunchesParties, picnics, and wine-downsFree parkingWe take your privacy very seriously. Please review our privacy policy to see exactly how we protect your information hereWe are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.Apixio will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Apixio prior to having a signed agreement from Talent Acquisition. Apixio is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its approved recruitment partners. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without an agreement in place will be considered your company‚Äôs gift to Apixio and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention and no fee will be paid.LI-RB1

Title: data scientist
Description: Dit informele en gezellige bedrijf net boven Leiden heeft in een kleine 8 jaar een flinke naam opgebouwd in de branche van sierteelt, food en agri. Met hun zelf ontwikkelde software analyseren, vergelijken en voorspellen zij de klantvraag. Hiermee ondersteunen zij tientallen organisaties, waaronder bloemisten, boeren en bloemkwekerijen. Door middel van een dagelijkse portefeuille scan adviseren zij hun cli√´nten over mogelijke besparingen, marktanalyses en een nauwkeurig inkoopbeleid. Eenvoud is hierin het kernwoord; complexe data en formules worden verwerkt in eenvoudige en bruikbare tooling waarmee de dienstverleners hun consumenten zo goed mogelijk van dienst kunnen zijn.Om de markt nog beter van dienst te kunnen zijn is mijn klant continue bezig met innovatie projecten en het ontwikkelen van diensten. Denk hierbij aan applicaties met een adviserende rol of applicaties met een voorspellende functies maar ook het verleggen van de focus naar Artificial Intelligence en Machine Learning.FunctieAls Data Scientist krijg je volledig de vrijheid om de projecten naar eigen wens in te vullen, waaronder de bepaling van de opzet en de technieken die gebruikt worden. Tijdens de verschillende projecten bestaan jouw werkzaamheden onder andere uit het verzamelen van data uit verschillende bronnen en beschikbaar maken van de desbetreffende data voor eigen ontwikkelde of bestaande databases en/of applicaties. Ook ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van ruwe data en kan dit vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en toepassingen. Hiervoor gebruik je data mining en machine learning technieken, waarmee je trends in de data opspoort. Deze visualiseer je vervolgens in overzichtelijke dashboards, zodat deze waardevol en toepasbaar worden voor de klant.EisenAfgeronde HBO/WO opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van Data Science, Mathematics en/of Software EngineeringBij voorkeur 1 jaar ervaring als Data ScientistErvaring met programmeertalen Python en R. Title: Machine Learning Product Manager
Description: About UsOur mission is to automate a 150-year-old legal process of due diligence, enabling anyone involved in a property transaction to properly understand what they are getting into, from the outset, before incurring legal fees.Orbital Witness is an award-winning LegalTech-meets-PropTech start-up focused on simplifying and accelerating the legal process in property transactions. We‚Äôve already saved over 130,000 hours of time - equivalent to over ¬£50m in legal fees and we‚Äôve only just begun! We experienced rapid growth during the pandemic as lawyers moved online and we‚Äôre looking to accelerate even further. We know how critically important early hires are, and we‚Äôre intentionally assembling a world-class team.We are backed by legendary early stage venture capital funds in Europe (including LocalGlobe and Seedcamp who have invested in tech unicorns Zoopla, Transferwise and UIpath) and some of the world‚Äôs largest real estate companies and financial institutions (JLL, Starwood Capital and Investec). https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/14/orbital-witnessWe value diversity at Orbital Witness, and would particularly encourage applications from those who are traditionally underrepresented in tech. We‚Äôd love to hear from you even if you don‚Äôt match all of the criteria outlined.Overview of the roleWe've launched a new product which is delivering much needed transparency to the home buying process, with a view to transform the way property is transacted.We are looking for an experienced Product Manager who has worked on and led the development of machine learning based products in the past. We want this person to deeply understand the interplay between engineering, data science and domain experts who translate the domain into labelled data that is ultimately used to train models which are the foundation of our product. You‚Äôll be taking over product management responsibilities from both the co-founder and CTO who have been sharing this workload for the past year. The team is currently composed of a Tech Lead (engineering), Head of Data Science, Data Scientist, Head of Legal Engineering, Legal Engineer and a paralegal data labeller and we‚Äôre actively hiring across more roles for this team.You‚Äôll get the chance to:Own the detailed product strategy of our new residential conveyancing product, reporting directly to the CTO, so we improve product-market fit and ultimately enable significant revenue growth #BoldAndAmbitious Set quarterly OKRs and weekly KPIs so the team is relentlessly focused on the most important thing #EatThatFrog Attend customer calls and visit customer offices around the UK to better understand use cases and gather customer feedback so it can be turned into requirements for the team to develop Relentlessly prioritise a roadmap and keep it up-to-date so that it can be shared at a high-level with the leadership and business development teams, as well as at a low-level so the team knows exactly what to work on next and for months into the futureManage feature development, bug fixing, automated testing, system maintenance and overall support for the product as we rapidly iterate on it for customersUse technology to improve both the quantity and quality of what we are currently delivering to customers. At the moment, our delivery team (made up of paralegals and conveyancers) are using a partially manual methodology, enhanced by some existing toolingLead a team full of highly competent and driven engineers, data scientists and legal engineersIdentify talent gaps in the team and have a significant input into the hiring plan so we achieve our goalsRequirementsYou should apply if:You‚Äôre an experienced Product Manager who has previously built machine learning products and understands the importance of both the quality and quantity of labelled data for the overall success of a productYou‚Äôre incredibly driven and want the opportunity to lead a significant part of Orbital Witness‚Äôs future growth. You also want to be held accountable for driving growth and will personally champion the setting up, sticking to and achieving of quarterly targetsYou are not intimidated by and enjoy context switching between deeply technical architecture / data science problems, learning a very specific domain language and its translation into labelled data, as well as high-level stakeholder management around business outcomes and revenue growth. You can assimilate all this information into a concise and easy to understand roadmap that the team and the wider business believes inYou foster healthy debate within the team so the right outcome is achieved not just an outcome. You should have a ‚Äústrong opinions weakly held‚Äù mentality so that you can lead the team effectively but also change your opinion when it‚Äôs wrong #QuestionOrCommit You feel very comfortable spending hours in Google Docs, Jira (or a similar ticket management system) and Metabase (or similar analytics tools) where you‚Äôll write clear requirements, prioritise work, respond to comments from team members and glean insights from metrics dashboards (ideally you might also know some SQL)You get how Kanban works and know first hand how it empowers a team to move quickly and iteratively while managing stakeholders expectations for deadlines and timeframes. You also have no problem talking about continuous delivery, lead time, cycle time and WIP limits.You enjoy making adjustments to the delivery process of shipping code into production so the team is hyper efficient. You also clearly understand the trade-offs involved with building a product that is accurate and high product versus speed of execution.BenefitsA fun and collaborative team environment. We don‚Äôt do egos.We benchmark to provide competitive salaries, matched pension contributions and equity options.Flexible working hours and location; you can choose to work from home or from our HQ in Central London (as well access to 40+ TOG spaces across London)25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays).Professional equipment and a ¬£1,000 p/a personal learning and development budget.Training opportunities to develop both your technical abilities and soft skills.Free access to the Spill Mental Health Support platform (we believe in looking after ourselves, mind and body).Cycle-to-work scheme.Generous parental leave policyAn inclusive community of colleagues where we can all enjoy all-company off-sites, lunches and team socials.
