Title: Data Analyst / Senior Data Analyst
Description: This role is pivotal in creating, maintaining and communicating key business performance and risk analysis to a wide range of stakeholders both within and outside the Analytics team. The main external stakeholders are the Supply Chain / Operations teams that rely on the Analytics team for reporting and metrics that inform their strategy and operational decision-making. This position plays a key role in identifying trends, developing analysis and guiding the strategic thinking of the company as it continues to grow and evolve in ways that are often unforeseen. You will apply your analytical and technical skills to take an end-to-end view of business operations and finance, requiring expertise with SQL, Tableau, strong data analytics, business intelligence, project management and financial planning capabilities. You will partner with cross-functional teams in the scoping and planning of key initiatives.Qualified candidates will have experience developing complex financial models in Excel, crafting their own SQL queries and tables, and constructing thorough dashboards using BI visualization tools (e.g. Tableau). This position will also provide other ad hoc analyses and data as needed. This role provides opportunities to work on challenging projects with virtually every team in the company, requiring the employee to use their creativity and analytical skills to craft solutions. The position reports to the Senior Finance & Analytics Manager.Specific job duties include:Data Analysis: Monitoring and analyzing data / reports / metrics to uncover risks and opportunities that allow the business to optimize and grow. Inform and influence business decisions at senior management levels through effective and timely data-driven analysis and insights. This will involve monthly and quarterly analysis and report-out to a wide range of stakeholders (both internal and external to Analytics) to identify variance to plan and other business risks and opportunities.Project Management: Developing and driving effective plans that help drive productivity, automation and standardization in the way our group creates and delivers key insights.Data Structures: Building effective data structures and optimizing the data environment such that our group can continue to deliver comprehensive and valuable reporting, summary statistics and insights to key stakeholders in a timely and consistent mannerFinancial Planning: Take a lead position in the annual planning cycle, which entails gathering, organizing and analyzing data, applying relevant forecasting rigor, interfacing with key business partners to gather insights and inputs to planning assumptions, and eventually communicating the outcomes of the planning process to a wide variety of stakeholders in a consistent and scalable manner to ensure wide-spread education and discipline across the operational teams.Business Partnering: This is a very visible and collaborative role, and will require you to work closely with a variety of senior managers and operational stakeholders on matters ranging from consistency and accuracy of reporting, trends within key metrics, and creating incremental capabilities to answer complex business questions.Other Responsibilities:Ensure accuracy and integrity of financial models, reporting, and databasesImprove processes for current reporting, automation, frequency, and efficiencyProvide ongoing support to the finance and operational departments as and when data and analysis is required to support decision makingIn-depth exploration of causes and trends to identify problems/opportunitiesUtilization of financial & statistical models that simulate and forecast business elementsCreation and redesign of dashboards and their underlying data structures to support the needs of various teamsQuantification of uncertainty and statistical variance in projections/scenariosQualificationsBachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics, mathematics, economics, or equivalent thereof)Minimum 2 years of work experience (4 years for Sr. Analyst) in a quantitative analyst position that entailed manipulating large swaths of data on a regular basis for analysis & reportingStrong SQL knowledge and demonstrable ability to use SQL to organize and analyze data is required for the roleExperience with scripting in R or Python strongly preferred, but not requiredHands-on experience with BI reporting tools required (Tableau preferred)Basic knowledge of statistics is required. Actuarial experience is a plusProven ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environmentProven ability to manage multiple projects and work streams autonomouslyStrong writing, presentation and communication skillsWillingness to learn and develop into a quantitative subject matter expert on claims and operational risk data in the companyAdditional InformationOur line-up of employee benefits include:Excellent benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and more)Flexible PTO401K with employer matching plan up to 5% of salaryHSA with employer contributionPaid parental leaveMonthly internet reimbursement directly in your paycheckMonthly wellness allowanceOpen access to mental health resources including therapy and coaching for employees and dependentsGenerous work-from-home set-up allowancePaid volunteer time to give back to the communityAccess to a diverse array of Employee Resource GroupsFlexible and hybrid work schedulesDevelopment and career growth opportunitiesThe Team: http://www.squaretrade.com/leadershipSquareTrade is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (ML Ops) - Spain
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
Description: ML Ops Engineer (AWS) - SpainHybrid/Remote way of workingWould you like to influence our human-centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project with a true impact in the Data Intelligence field? Do you have a solid background in industrializing Big Data Solutions as well as dealing with large amounts of data? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!In the CoE of Advanced Analytics in Fujitsu we are currently looking for an ML Ops Engineer to continue the growth of our team in Spain, leverage our product portfolio and develop new data-driven solutions that address the business challenges our customers are currently facing. You will work with data loading processes, master data management, data migrations, and real-time processes.Your work environment will be based on AWS technologies, with a special focus on Data Scientist cloud tools: SageMaker, Redshift, etc.; as well as Python. You will maintain AI models once they go live in production environments, controlling all the steps in the end-to-end development process.What is in it for you?When you join our team, we offer you a competitive salary and secondary benefits. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with lots of room for personal growth. We offer additional training possibilities and the opportunity to expand your career internationally while working for an employer awarded the Great Place to Work Certification 2021-2022: https://www.fujitsu.com/es/about/great-place/ Your profileYou have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, or Engineering and at least 2 years of proven experience in ML Ops and Cloud environments. Solid programming skills, ideally in Python, (SDK, CDK, boto3,) to build ML algorithms and stand-alone processes and jobs for data analysis. Experience and knowledge of AWS MLOps cloud tools (special focus in Sagemaker, S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift, etc.).You are able to deploy your own data processes, ETLs, and algorithms into the Cloud;Knowledge of ML and Data processing tools (Jupyter Notebooks, SKLLearn, Pandas, Numpy)Experience working in Agile teams and working with DevOps principles, and experience in working with Git and Git Flow. You have a natural passion for technology and software development and, therefore, you understand the importance of writing high-quality and reusable code. On a personal level, you like taking the initiative, you are eager to learn, and enjoy working in a team. On top of that, you are also fluent in Spanish and have a good level of English.Shape your world and achieve togetherWe want the best people on our team, so we welcome and encourage applications from people with a diverse variety of experiences, backgrounds, and identities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all. If you want to work alongside people with different ideas, in an inclusive business, that will welcome you and support you, come and co-create the future at Fujitsu.About FujitsuSince being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers. Fujitsu is part of FORTUNE Magazine's 2022 list of "World's Most Admired Companies" for the fourth year running.More information: www.fujitsu.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description: My client is one of the leading global dairy trading firms, both in physical as well as financial products. To support further growth of our business, this company is putting digital and analytics in the core of our business strategy. Our Global Analytics team acts as the innovation center on advanced analytics and data science, supporting the strategic agenda set by the Executive Committee. Over the past years, we have built a healthy analytics environment and we are keen to keep working on more use case developments and continuous improvement. This opportunity is for supporting data professionals to grow fast with our organization. The digital roles will work in close collaboration and will maintain close ties with the other IT teams (Process & Projects, Digital & Integrations, Cloud & Ops) as well as business functions.Functie‚Äì Have proven experience working with cloud-based data and model processing pipelines including testing andmonitoring.‚Äì Have knowlegde in the code collaboration tooling (Git), including CI with bash. This is essential to our teamwork.‚Äì Are familiar with a scripting programming language. This skill is a must and Python is a pre.‚Äì Know how to work with ML Ops paradigm, ML flow is a pre.‚Äì Possess knowledge about the commodity / financial trading industry.‚Äì Are comfortable working in DevOps / Scrum methodology.‚Äì We encourage ML engineers, data engineers as well as software engineers who enjoy data engineering work to apply.Eisen Have knowledge and experience with programming languages Python, R and/or MATLAB is a must. Other languages such as C(++), JavaScript or PHP are a pre. Possess hands-on databasing skills (e.g. SQL); ETL and data platform integration (Azure/AWS, APIs). Are (willing to become) an expert in statistical / machine learning methods such as Recurrent Neural Nets, stochastic volatility, Bayesian MCMC, Random Forests, SVM, gradient boosting, (non)linear regression. - Experience working with ML tooling (e.g. Spark, Keras, TensorFlow, GPUs, parallel CPUs, Kubernetes, GitHub). Have experience with Data Science tooling such as parallel / distributed CPU and GPU, Keras / TensorFlow, Azure ML / MLflow, Docker/Kubernetes is an important pre. Have knowledge of .NET, C# and/or Java implementation for APIs is considered a plus. We encourage data scientists and data analysts with DS skills who want to develop further in DS roles to apply.AanbodSalary is based on your knowledge.8% holliday payment.Part of an experienced international team in the Netherlands.Main language in the company is English and dutch is a plus.

Title: Data Science Specialist
Industries: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing and Financial Services
Description: The data scientist will develop models based on advanced analytics and solutions of intelligent exploitation of the data in the Credit department with the aim to make the credit value chain more efficient and quicker in 18 countries. MAIN ACTIVITIES AND TASKS:Build machine learning and analytics models for acceptation, fraud or collection;Propose and develop technical solutions to answer business analytical needs;Define and implement strategies to maximize the turnover and profitability within the respect of the validated Risk Appetite Framework;Identify useful data in IT system and monitor data quality with automated codes;Challenge and enhance existing models;Ensure models improvements;Collaborate with business lines and ensure comprehension of delivered models and follow up of models performance and business lines usage;Participate to the Data Science community of the shareholders;Present the results to the stakeholders involved in the decisional process. ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS:Master degree in Statistics, Data Science, Quantitative Finance, Applied Mathematics or similar. EXPERIENCE:Minimum 2 years of experience in credit models development, including the use of machine learning techniques. REQUIREMENTS: Knowledge of supervised and unsupervised modeling techniques (random forest, SVM, neural network, bagging, boosting, clustering, k-means, XGBM, Light GBM, etc.);Knowledge and understanding of banking and credit environments would be appreciated. IT TOOLS: Good skills with at least two of the following languages: MATLAB, Python, C , C++, and R;Expert user of statistical software like SAS and Microsoft Office.  SKILLS PROFILE:Strong sense of responsibility, organization, rigor and quality of work;Dynamism, proactivity, multitasking and a strong spirit of initiative;Autonomy, flexibility and goal orientation;Ability to understand the context and to evaluate in a challenging and fast growing environment;Adaptability and ability to go beyond the basics duties;Ability to communicate results to business, IT and managers in a simple way in spite of expertise domain;Good interpersonal and communication skills;Ability to work in an international environment;High proficiency in English (written and spoken);Ability to work as a team.

Title: Grad Intern - Biomics Data Science (Remote)
Description: HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?Do more with the knowledge youre working hard to acquire and the passion you already have. At Amgen, our shared missionto serve patientsdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the worlds leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Through this program, you will acquire the valuable hands-on skills and foundational experience to become the professional you are meant to be in your chosen field.Grad Intern - Biomics Data ScienceLiveThis could be your everydayLets do this. Lets change the world. During this program, you will join our Biomics Data Science team in building up a proteomics data compendium and applying it to biomarker discovery, drug target identification and patients stratification. This data resource would provide rich information about protein expression distribution and specificity across normal and diseased tissues, which is a valuable complement to the RNA data for biomarker and drug target studies.Collect external and internal Proteome datasets to make a data resource for protein expression across tissues, cell lines and diseasesSummarize protein annotation including localization, function categorization, GO, pathway, and etcBuild a web application for the query of protein expression and annotationIntegrate the resource to our existing tools such as omics browser and/or tissue-specific single-cell atlasesWinHeres What It Takes To WinWe are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The interested individual we seek is a curious, cooperative, and diligent thinker with these qualifications:Basic QualificationsAmgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:18 years or olderGraduated with a Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalentCurrently enrolled in an MBA program for an MBA internship OR a Masters program for aMasters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR Ph.D. for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university and completion of the first year of MBA ORMasters OR Pharm D OR Ph.D. program before the internship startsEnrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignmentMust not be employed at the time the internship startsStudent must be located in the United States for the duration of the internshipPreferred QualificationsDegree concentration(s) in computational biology, data science, or software developmentExperience in working with multi-omics data, and especially the proteomics dataExperience in working with Linux environment and data science tools for visualization and reporting resultsExperience in developing web application, database, and working with big dataThriveWhat You Can Expect Of UsAs we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates professional and personal growth in addition to their well-being:The base pay range for this opportunity in the U.S. is $30.00 - $40.00 per hour.Build a network of colleagues that will endure and grow throughout your time with us and beyond.Bring your authentic self to the table and become the professional youre inspired to be through accepting a culture that values the diversity of thought and experience and will flex to your strengths and possibilities.Participate in executive and social networking events, as well as community volunteer projects.Apply nowfor an internship/co-op that defies imaginationIf you feel like you're part of something bigger, it's because you are. Join us.careers.amgen.com Please search for Keyword R-155623Join UsIf you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.Amgen requires all staff in the United States, Puerto Rico and Canada to be vaccinated from COVID 19 as a condition of employment. In accordance with applicable law, Amgen will provide reasonable accommodations to staff members who qualify on the basis of a medical reason or a sincerely held religious belief, practice, or observance. Such accommodation may not pose an undue hardship to Amgen, its operations, or its staff.

Title: Imaging Scientist
Description: Summary The display visual experience team is looking for an individual to discover and develop algorithms for future Apple products. This position will focus on novel deep learning, display algorithm, application, and prototyping to enable the best front-of-screen experience of Apple products including iPhone, iPad, Watch, Mac and more. Experience on device forward and and inverse modeling using deep learning a plus. The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that cultivates engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation in the interdisciplinary areas of image science, machine learning, computer science, and optics. Key Qualifications Demonstrated ability in algorithm development for imaging systemsStrong proficiency in machine learning and deep learningStrong understanding in image processing, computer vision and AR/VR renderingProficiency in Python, TensorFlow/Pytorch, MATLABExperience using deep learning for inverse modelingStrong interpersonal skills for working with cross functional teamsExcellent written and verbal communication skills in English Description -  Develop next generation computational display algorithms and deep learning models to enable outstanding visual quality on display systems-  Explore the application of computational display through modeling, simulations, psychophysical experiments, and prototypes-  Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide strong leadership and expertise in fields of study-  Be able to chip in to and lead technology development and productization Education & Experience M.S. or Ph.D. (preferred) in computer science, image science, EE or equivalent Pay & Benefits At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $115,000 and $217,500, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program. Role Number: 200432693

Title: Data Scientist
Industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Consumer Services
Description: JOB SUMMARYPurpose Financial is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data Science team to help support risk management function of our consumer loan portfolio. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data analytics, predictive modeling and is comfortable working with large data sets. This role works closely with the management to perform analysis and help them make informed decisions about lending and managing the risks. Furthermore, this role requires someone who quickly adapts to change and is willing to complete all duties as assigned and requested.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and implement advanced statistical and machine learning models leveraged through the customer lifecycle which includes, (but not limited to) new customer acquisition, underwriting, conversion, collections, and retention.Evaluate the performance of existing models and design experiments to improve model performance via champion/challenger tests.Discover insights from additional data sources to understand/influence consumer financial behavior and continue to enhance machine learning models as additional data becomes available.Develop automated processes and procedures to streamline data analysis and reporting. Monitor trends in relevant KPIs and report on key insights on a regular basis.‚ÄúAd-Hoc‚Äù analysis as assigned.Understand, adhere to, and enforce all corporate policies.Equivalent Education Level Required:  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field. (Advanced Degree preferred.)Experience Preferred: 1 ‚Äì 2 years of experience working in an analytical role in banking, finance, or retail. Prior experience in developing machine learning models is preferred.QualificationsExperience in building machine learning models using R or Python.Exposure to reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI.Experience with the different types of machine learning techniques and the usual Python data science stack (Pandas, scikit-learn, NumPy, XGBoost, SHAP, notebook environments, etc.) is preferred. Working knowledge of SQL.Ability to combine data from multiple sources to analyze and interpret business performance. Excellent written and verbal communications skills as would be needed to communicate in person, by phone, and through email.Adaptability and flexibility to changing environment; and comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Ability to interact professionally and exhibit appropriate social skills. Ability to understand and ensure compliance with policies, procedures, and laws governing our industry/business and products. Ability to quickly learn all technology needed to perform the role. Physical Requirements: Sitting for long periods of time; standing occasionally; walking; bending; squatting; kneeling; pushing/pulling; reaching; twisting; frequent lifting of less than 10 lbs., occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs.; driving and having access during the workday to an insured and reliable transportation; typing; data entry; grasping; transferring items between hands and/or to another person or receptacle; use of office equipment to include computers; ability to travel to, be physically present at, and complete the physical requirements of the position at any assigned location. Travel: 5%Attire: Business CasualOther: Must be eligible to work in the USA and able to pass a background check.

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description: Eikon Therapeutics is a new biopharmaceutical company employing revolutionary technology at the intersection of chemistry, engineering, computation, and biology to discover novel treatments for life-threatening diseases. Eikon‚Äôs discovery platform is built on groundbreaking innovations from its founders (Nobel Prize, 2014), culminating in the creation of microscopes which enable real time, molecular-resolution measurements of protein movement in living cells, thereby unlocking otherwise intractable classes of proteins as drug targets.PositionAs a Biological Data Scientist, you will work to better understand large high-throughput datasets. You will support data analysis for external scientific collaborations while developing novel analysis tools and workflows.About YouYou have a passion for understanding biology via novel high-throughput data generation. You enjoy multidisciplinary scientific collaborations. You are conscientious and value scientific reproducibility and intelligibility as much as innovation. You can juggle competing priorities and stay focused on long-term goals, while having the flexibility to keep up with the pace of experimental science.What You‚Äôll DoCollaborate both internally and externally with biologists and chemists to better understand large datasets Work with research, software development, engineering, and product teams to create data analysis tools for internal and external stakeholders Communicate complex analyses internally and to external scientific collaborators QualificationsPh.D. in computer science / bioinformatics / computational biology or equivalent experience 5+ years of experience with biological data analysis Strong expertise in scientific python (e.g., pandas, scipy, matplotlib) Experience with large image derived datasets Expertise in data workflow management systems (e.g., Snakemake, Nextflow) a plus Cell imaging experience is a plus Customer facing experience is strongly preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills Team oriented, flexible, able to adapt to rapidly evolving goals and challenges Enthusiasm for gaining biological and drug discovery experience essential At Eikon, employee compensation also includes bonus and equity compensation, in addition to several generous benefit programs, including: 401k plan with company matching Medical (premiums covered by Eikon at 95%), dental and vision insurance (premiums covered by Eikon at 100%) Mental health and wellness benefits Weeklong summer and winter holiday shutdowns Generous paid time off and holiday policies Life/AD&D Insurance (premiums covered by Eikon at 100%) and optional supplemental employee-paid life/AD&D policies Enhanced parental leave benefit Daily subsidized lunch program when on-siteThe expected salary range for this role is. $143,000 to $165,000 depending on skills, competency, and the market demand for your expertise.

Title: Lead Research Scientist, Machine Learning
Description: About Incieve¬†We are pure research company focusing on out-of-distribution generalization which is one of the most fundamental problems why‚ÄØartificial general intelligence is yet out of reach. Any advance in this field unfolds numerous real-world applications. We are aspiring to bringing these advances closer to the reality by transforming them into the useful products potentially benefiting all humanity.¬†We are part of cutting-edge research in the area currently focusing on following topics which may offer a way‚ÄØhow to go‚ÄØbeyond the iid hypothesis‚ÄØand more generally the assumption that the test cases come from the same distribution as the training set, so we can build more versatile AIs robust to changes in their environment. To achieve out-of-distribution robustness we explore two research directions.¬†Causal learning‚ÄØi.e. figuring out what are the causal variables and how they are causally related, as this is a crucial part of understanding how the world works.¬†Modularizing knowledge‚ÄØso it can be factorized into pieces that can be‚ÄØre-used for fast transfer‚ÄØand adaptation.¬†¬†Responsibilities¬†Manage research projects.Define and execute research projects by properly aligning goals and priorities with activities and resources required.¬†Create project proposal and communicate key information to drive technical decisions.¬†Prioritize work streams to manage and balance workload and intensity of technical project.¬†Develop strategies and provide subject matter expertise.¬†Propose, discuss, develop and implement novel and existing methods for out-of-distribution generalization in deep learning.¬†¬†Write high quality and detailed research summaries.¬†Discuss AI-related scientific papers.¬†Discover new opportunities for further research.¬†About you¬†You have more than 3 years experience with neural networks research. Experience with‚ÄØout-of-distribution generalization of  neural networks.Experience with modular neural network architectures.Experience with causal learning using neural networks.¬†Ability to read and understand AI-related scientific papers.¬†You have solid background in deep learning scientific papers ideally related to modularity and causality.You have experience with a machine learning framework such as PyTorch,‚ÄØTensorFlow.¬†You are passionate about your work for both technical merits and its strong purpose.¬†Ability to work autonomously.¬†Creative, open minded, continually self-improving and strive for innovative ideas.¬†What we offer¬†Employee Stock Option.¬†A laptop of your choice & necessary tech is a given.¬†Spacious & uncrowded office.¬†5 weeks of vacation, flexible working hours + 5 sick days.¬†Competitive salary and a generous bonus model.¬†Self-improvement ‚Äì a day per week to study.¬†No stress from redundant conference meetings/calls.¬†Effective development & processes not delayed by bureaucracy.¬†About us¬†Machine learning team currently consisting of 2 people with a strategy to grow. As we are early phase startup you are going to be key element in decisions shaping our future, you will not be a mere small piece in a large team.¬†¬†https://incieve.com/about/¬†¬†Type: Full-time, Contract¬†Possible start: Immediately or upon discussion¬†Location: Remote or Prague on site

Title: Data Scientist
Description: About The CompanyThe Functionary has brilliant and passionate people with the energy and ambition to succeed! If you are ready to make an immediate impact and you want to work with the best, then The Functionary may be the place for you.The Functionary is a leading provider of business process support services to consumers, small businesses, mid-market, and enterprise customers. The Functionary partners with retailers, OEMs, and distributors to provide support solutions to customers needing help with customer support, e-commerce operations, setup, connectivity, Internet of Things (IoT) devices, and cloud services. The Functionary has handled over 5 million support requests, delivering market-leading customer satisfaction scores, to empower customers to get the help they need when they need it.Summary Of The PositionClient Overview‚ÄØ‚ÄØIn the new economy, the life of the average consumer is marked by a series of financial hurdles that require immediate solutions. The great stress for most consumers is the tremendous insecurity of operating without any kind of safety net. Essential Lending exists to eliminate that stress for our customers. With our loans, we aim to carve out a brand-new territory in the short-term lending space where the products we offer help establish a launchpad from which our clients can grow and build a new financial life built on security and stability.Job Description‚ÄØ‚ÄØThe Data Scientist will perform highly quantitative, data-driven analysis and make recommendations regarding how we should operate our business more effectively. While technical proficiency such as manipulating data with SQL and understanding predictive modeling techniques like logistic regression are necessary, the ideal candidate will have an aptitude for problem-solving and business acumen.Examples of tasks this candidate may be requested to performDevelop a new credit underwriting model. Determine how to utilize it and what the expected benefits to the business will be. Apply the new underwriting model score to existing loans, evaluate payment performance by score, and recommend a score threshold that will maximize profitability. Create a linear programming optimization model to set pricing for the purchase of potential applicants (i.e. leads). This entails creating an optimal pricing strategy that maximizes total profit by balancing the applicant‚Äôs likelihood of receiving a loan, the likely loan amount, the expected loan payment performance, and the expected total number of loans. Design an A/B test between two data vendors. Coordinate with our technology team to build and execute the collection of data, conduct a cost/benefit analysis and recommend which data product to use. Must HavesAptitude for solving business problems via data analysis Excellent communication skills and fluency in English Knowledge of statistics and predictive modeling techniques such as linear and logistic regression T-SQL experience. Candidate MUST be proficient and be able to hit the ground running regarding developing SQL queries. Familiarity with Microsoft Excel and willingness to learn advanced Excel features such as pivot tables, calculated fields, etc. Proficiency with Python. Nice to HavesFamiliarity with SAS is a plus. Familiarity with Direct Mail marketing channel analysis is a plus. Familiarity with Line of Credit products is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist/Analyst
Description: The Hub Program at Client is modernizing its data reporting by improving user experience and introducing internal efficiencies, including the automation of indicator methodology calculations.Our Client's disclosures of health information are made at the highest degree of anonymity possible while still meeting the research and/or analytical purposes. Client publicly releases aggregated data in a manner designed to minimize any risk of re-identification and residual disclosure.Client is endeavouring to automate complex statistical disclosure controls (e.g. small cell-size suppression) to reduce the burden of their manual application, thereby introducing internal efficiencies and improve the timeliness of our reporting.ServicesAssess three statistical disclosure control tools (G-Confid, Tau-Argus and sdcTable) for their ability to meet Client's need to automate statistical disclosure control techniques (e.g. primary and complementary cell suppressions, rounding, etc) for a variety of multi-dimensional, linked and hierarchical aggregate data tables sourcing clinical databases and survey data, with the goal of minimizing disclosure risk while maximizing information utility. Conduct a proof of concept demonstrating the tools' features and capabilities using a variety of aggregate Client data tables, while highlighting how each of the tools could fit into operational data production processes.Write a report summarizing the findings and recommend which among these tools would best meet Client needs. Create plain-language documentation to support the application of preferred disclosure control techniques to aggregate data sets using the recommended tool. Knowledge transfer to support ongoing in-house operational application of the preferred statistical disclosure control techniques for future data releases.Skill or Knowledge Skill Required Skill Level *(Intermediate or Senior) COTS Configuration/Development SAS Macro Yes Intermediate SAS Programming Yes Intermediate Big Data Python Yes Intermediate R Yes Intermediate Leadership / Business Skills Analysis Yes Intermediate CIHI Business Understanding Yes Industry Best Practices/ Trends Yes Intermediate Problem-Solving Yes Senior Process Automation Yes Senior Verbal Communication Yes Intermediate Workflow Design Yes Intermediate Written Communication Yes Intermediate Coaching/ Mentoring Yes Intermediate Other G-Confid Yes Intermediate Tau-Argus Yes Intermediate sdcTable Yes Intermediate

Title: Data Science & Machine Learning Intern: Omics
Description: The OpportunityGlobal drug development productivity is declining exponentially, with an overall failure to develop effective treatments for many increasingly prevalent complex diseases affecting millions of patients per year. We seek to solve this by combining cutting-edge machine learning techniques with recent advances in life sciences to drastically improve how drugs are discovered and developed.This summer we are looking for highly motivated interns looking to work at the intersection of machine learning and life sciences. As an omics intern, you will play a key role in modeling the molecular omics phenotypes of cells with different genetic / chemical perturbations, environmental exposures, and genetic backgrounds. As molecular omics is one of the two major ways that insitro leverages to model disease phenotypes, your contribution will be critical for identifying genes and pathways that are relevant to diseases, validating and understanding the role of gene hits from statistical genetics studies, and aligning phenotypic models between in vivo and in vitro systems.Insitro has a highly dynamic and collaborative culture in a custom-built open office in South San Francisco. You will work closely with machine learning engineers and scientists, biologists, chemists, microscopy experts, and automation engineers. You will be mentored by one of our senior researchers, who has significant experience in machine learning for molecular omics data. You will also attend our machine learning team meetings and will be exposed to a diverse set of novel technologies and machine learning concepts that tackle various biological questions.Join us, and help make a difference to patients!About YouWorking towards a BS, MS, or Ph.D. in an engineering, computer science, mathematics, statistics, life science, chemistry, physics, or a related disciplineProficiency in one or more general-purpose programming languages. We primarily use PythonDemonstrated ability to use and develop cutting edge statistical and machine learning methods inspired by real problemsDemonstrated ability to write high-quality, production-ready code (readable, well-tested, with well-designed APIs)Experience in working with biological data, preferably using computational approachesAbility to communicate effectively and collaborate with people of diverse backgrounds and job functionsPassion for making a difference in the worldNice to HaveDemonstrated ability to process and model molecular omics data such as RNA-seq or ATAC-seq, in particular the single-cell version of these assaysCourses in molecular biology, computational biology, bioinformatics, biomedical science, biostatistics or other related topicsExperience in Linux environment, database languages (e.g., SQL, No-SQL) and version control practices and tools such as Git or MercurialFamiliarity with the SciPy/PyData ecosystem (numpy, pandas, scipy, dask etc.)Familiarity with cloud computing services (AWS or GCP)Intern BenefitsExcellent medical, dental, and vision coverage; insitro pays 100% of premiums for employeesExcellent mental health and well-being supportAccess to free onsite baristas and cafe with daily lunch and breakfastAccess to free onsite fitness centerCommuter benefitsCompetitive payFlexible work schedule (on site and remote)Compensation & Benefits At InsitroOur target starting salary for successful US-based applicants for this role is $50 - $55 per hour. To determine starting pay, we consider multiple job-related factors including a candidate‚Äôs skills, education and experience, the level at which they are actually hired, market demand, business needs, and internal parity. We may also adjust this range in the future based on market data.In addition, insitro also provides our interns:Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage; insitro pays 100% of premiums for employeesExcellent mental health and well-being supportAccess to free onsite baristas and cafe with daily lunch and breakfastAccess to free onsite fitness centerCommuter benefitsCompetitive payFlexible work schedule (on site and remote)About Insitroinsitro is a data-driven drug discovery and development company using machine learning and data at scale to transform the way that drugs are discovered and developed for patients. insitro is developing predictive machine learning models to discover underlying biologic state based on human cohort data and in-house generated cellular data at scale. These predictive models can be brought to bear on key bottlenecks in pharmaceutical R&D to advance novel targets and patient biomarkers, design therapeutics, and inform clinical strategy. insitro is advancing a wholly owned and partnered pipeline of biologic insights and molecules in neuroscience and metabolic diseases. Since formation in mid 2018, insitro has raised over $700 million from top tech, biotech, and crossover investors and from collaborations with pharmaceutical partners. For more information on insitro, please visit the company‚Äôs website at www.insitro.com .

Title: Senior Data Scientist

The Quantitative Researcher will work with the team to:Conduct quantitative research and analysis relating to equity trading, equity alpha generation, and portfolio constructionDevelop intraday trading strategies and equity trading executionDevelop broad-based statistical arbitrage alphas and trading strategiesWhat you‚Äôll bring:MS or PhD degree in highly quantitative field, including Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Financial Engineering, etc.1-3 years of working experience in quantitative researchStrong programming skills are required, Python and SQL expertise are absolute mustExperience with equity trading, flow data is preferredExperience with intraday trading and transaction cost analysis is preferredExperience with cloud computing is preferredThe ideal candidate will have: Passion for quantitative research, strong self-motivation and curiosityIndependent research experience and/or demonstrated proficiency in statistical methods and problem-solving skillsRigorous and scalable research processGood capability of time management and prioritizationOutstanding attention to detail and strong organization skills With respect to NY-based applicants, the starting base pay range for this role is between $130,000 and $200,000 annually. The actual base pay is dependent upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant experience, business needs and market demands. This role may also be eligible for bonus compensation and employee benefits.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Machine Learning Engineer At Onclusive, we are passionate about building software that solves important problems in marketing and communications. We partner with the most valuable companies in the world to transform how they use data and technology to drive marketing and brand decisions. Our software has been used to strategize responses to a brand crisis, discover new content and influencers, and gain an edge in the global online business world.As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work on deploying, scaling, and optimizing backend algorithms to support robust and scalable data ingestion pipelines, machine learning services, and data platforms to support analysis on vast amounts of text and analytics data. You will apply your technical knowledge and Big Data analytics on Onclusive‚Äôs billions of online content data points to solve challenging marketing problems. ML Ops Engineers are integral to the success of Onclusive.Responsibilities:Design and build scalable machine learning services and data platforms.Research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.Work with data scientists and machine learning engineers to implement ML, AI, and NLP techniques for article analysis and attribution.Deploy, manage, and optimize inference services on autoscaling fleets with GPUs and specialized inference hardware.This position is not centered around creating internal dashboards and reports (eg. Tableau) and is primarily focused around working with large state of the art foundation models, tuning to our use cases, and deploying at scale.Key QualificationsBS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field and/or equivalent experience in the space.1+ years of machine learning research experience.1+ years of NLP experience focusing on neural network approaches (BERT, BART, RoBERTa, etc.)1+ years of cloud computing experience (preferably AWS).Comfortable with modern tools for building ML pipelines, including data processing, training, inference, and evaluation.Proficiency with frameworks and models such as Pytorch, Torchserve, TensorFlow, TF Serving, Kubernetes, Docker, Kubeflow, MLflow.Work RemotelyYes Language skillsCandidate must be able to speak fluent English

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description: About the RoleWe‚Äôre looking for a driven senior data analytics leader with a passion for data and storytelling to work on our core products and help drive informed business decisions for Outward. You will enjoy working with cutting edge technology and collaborate with cross-functional team members while having the opportunity to see your insights impact our main products in terms of roadmap and revenue.The perfect candidate will have a background in a technical field, have hands-on experience working with (large) data stores, reporting automation and excel in identifying and presenting business critical stories. You are scrappy, focused on results, a self-starter, and have demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression, and user engagement of a product.We are looking for someone who can navigate the technical complexity of the space and the solutions while also managing and supporting a broad and diverse range of stakeholders.The ideal candidate will be able to really absorb what the business is like and tell a story with the data. Large e commerce experience a plus.This role will lead several Data Analysis charters across Outward‚Äôs product line and will be focused on improving the products that our users rely on and will drive the roadmap and company revenue. Responsibilities:Be proactive with asking strategic data questions, ensuring that the right questions are being answered with appropriate level of rigor and that analyses lead to clear and actionable recommendations and impactful product changesCommunicate and represent results of analyses to leadershipLead data mining and collection procedures Be able to inquire and gather data on demand. Ensure data quality and integrityInterpret and analyze data problems Conceive, plan and prioritize data projects Build analytic systems and predictive models Visualize data and create reportsExperiment with new models and techniques Align data projects with organizational goalsExperience:4+ years of proven experience as a sr Data Analyst with solid knowledge and experience of data management, automation and visualization techniques.A knack for statistical analysis and predictive modelingGood knowledge of R, PythonExperience with GraphQL and TabelauExperience with applied statistics or experimentation (i.e. A/B testing) in an industry settingExperience communicating and representing results of analysis to senior leadership Experience in managing other team members in a formal or informal capacityA love for or background with interior design is a huge plus!Why you will love working at Outward, Inc.We‚Äôre a successful, fast-growing company with an entrepreneurial vibeA technologically and data-driven businessCompetitive salaries and comprehensive health benefitsWe‚Äôre at the forefront of tech and eCommerce, redefining technology for the next generationWe‚Äôre passionate about our internal and external clients and live/breathe the client experienceWe get to be creative dailyA smart, experienced leadership team that wants to do it right and is open to new ideasWe believe in autonomy and reward taking initiativeWe have fun!Benefits Just for YouMedical, Dental, Vision401KPaid time offCompany-sponsored team events such as regular staff parties Friendly, caring co-workers and managementGenerous employee discount at all Williams Sonoma brandsWho is Outward Inc?Outward Inc. is a visual transformation technology company. Since 2012, our team of inventors, technologists, brand experts, and changemakers, have been reinventing the retail customer shopping journey through innovations in product visualizations.Using cutting-edge 3D, AR/VR, and web technologies, Outward is bringing the advantages of automated, AI-perfected product photography to our clients ‚Äî allowing them to produce a large volume of product images at the push of a button and publish them in any format ‚Äî from e-commerce to traditional media.These innovations enable a breadth of digital experiences and meaningful interactions between manufacturers and retailers of all sizes, and their customers.Outward, Inc. is based in San Jose, CA and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Williams Sonoma, Inc. (www.outwardinc.com). Outward, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity EmployerFor California Only:The expected starting pay range for this position is $140,000 -175,000. Applicable pay ranges may differ across markets. Actual pay will be determined based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law. In addition to competitive pay, compensation may include a variety of other components like benefits, paid time off, merit, and bonus opportunitiesAbout UsOur CompanyFounded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of high-quality products for the kitchen and home in the United States. Our family of brands are Williams Sonoma, Williams Sonoma Home, Pottery Barn, Pottery Barn teen, pottery barn kids, Rejuvenation, Mark & Graham, west elm, or Outward. These brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We offer beautifully-designed, stylish and functional products for every area of the home, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, home office, closet, laundry room and even outdoor spaces. We've seen some big changes since our first brick-and-mortar store opened more than half of a century ago. What hasn't changed is our passion for high-quality products, functional design, outstanding customer service, and enhancing the lives of our customers and the communities where we operate. Today, we're a multi-brand, multi-channel, global enterprise supported by state-of-the-art technology and some of the most talented teams in retailing - and we're always looking for new energy and ideas.

Title: Python Developer - Contract
Description: Job Title: Python DeveloperDay Rate: ¬£400 - ¬£500 Outside IR35Location: Hybrid/Remote (offices in London, Leeds and Uppingham)‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶The OpportunityIn this role you will be responsible for building high-performing, responsive web applications. Working in a multidisciplinary team consisting of technical architects, developers, and cloud engineers you will be an embedded member of the team helping to deliver value.An ideal candidate should be highly adept at writing clean, testable, and scalable Python code to develop back-end elements, integrate the front-end elements in applications, and manage the data interchange between the server and the users. You will have a deep understanding of cloud technologies such as AWS and experience of using AWS in a commercial setting.You should also have a basic understanding of front-end technologies and have worked in collaboration with front-end developers.In order to flourish in this role, we would expect to see the followingExtensive experience of using Python to develop web applications Have demonstrable experience of web frameworks such as Django Have experience of Lambda, SQS, and Step Functions (AWS) It would also be great (but not essential) if you have:Experience of working in an agile environment Experience of working with enterprise level clients Additional AWS networking skills such as VPCs and Terraform This is a hybrid/remote role with the expectation that you will be available onsite for client meetings as required but can otherwise work from one of our offices in Leeds, London or Uppingham, or from home.Please note you must currently hold valid UK Right to Work documentation in order to take up this position.About UsWe are the digital change makers.At MMT, we build platforms and partnerships that empower businesses to realise digital value, faster.By cutting through complexity with the agility to think and do, we guide our clients to be digitally better ‚Äì making positive impact for our clients teams, customers and bottom line. Where challenges exist with innovation, strategy, speed of delivery, customer experience and costly infrastructure, MMT can deliver measurable results and help businesses achieve digital maturity at speed.We partner with clients such as Boots, Vodafone and BP to equip them with all what‚Äôs needed to successfully innovate and lead the industry with a digital-first approach. We also work with organisations like Translink and Sovereign to create future facing platforms and services for their customers.Our one team culture means we build open and honest relationships that last.We are part of MSQ, a joined-up community of best-in-class agencies, helping businesses build high EQ brands to attract, convert, retain and grow valuable customers.What Motivates UsEverything we do is driven by our three core values ‚Äì Fairness, Commercialism and Quality.‚ÄØThese values influence our ways of working, how we treat each other, and how we engage with our clients. They also guide and shape our behaviours and mean we are clear about what we stand for.Our commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion‚ÄúA place to belong, be valued and thrive‚ÄùAs a part of the MSQ Partners group we are committed to and believe in building an inclusive culture with quality of opportunity and advancement through fairness and transparency.That means working together to create a culture where everyone can thrive and succeed; striving towards no pay gender gap, increasing ethnic and gender diversity at all levels of our company, training our people in areas that promote minority, racial and gender equity, and ensuring the diversity and inclusivity of our work product.RequirementsWe‚Äôre looking for people with solid project experience developing web applications in large organisations. You will need to be a good communicator and have the ability to problem solve along with experience in Python and some working knowledge of AWS.

Title: Snr Data Scientist (TS/SCI w/Poly needed)
Description: First off, let me give you some basic info:You‚Äôd be working on one of their contracts in Fort Meade, MD, spending 80% of the week onsite.Given the nature of the work, you‚Äôd need to have TS/SCI clearance, along with a Poly (CI and/or FSP) to get your foot in the door.(Unfortunately, this isn‚Äôt negotiable).Salary wise, I can see them paying up to $185,000 DOE.The packages include PTO (11 days, plus your birthday off), insurance cover (health, dental and vision), 401k/ESOP, life insurance, paid sabbaticals, and a healthy training budget to enhance your learning.So, why would you want to work here?Well, from the top down they‚Äôve done everything they can to build a great training culture.Part of this includes providing lower billing targets, usually 32-36 hours per week (not 45-50 at some of the larger consultancies).This means you can spend more time focusing on yourself, with allocated time every week on your own development, working towards external certifications and taking exams.You‚Äôd also have free access to online courses.Every week, all staff are invited to attend learning lunches, usually headed up by a specialist within their field, to share knowledge across the board.Anyway, about the work.You‚Äôll spend most of your time creating and deploying predictive models, typically from a wide variety of data sources and types using mathematical and statistical methods.You‚Äôll work with stakeholders to understand the problems they‚Äôre trying to fix, exploring and wrangling data, writing re-usable code in R, Python, Java, Scala, SQL, etc. ‚Äì this could mean preparing presentations, writing reports etc.If you could bring any consulting experience to the table then great, but it‚Äôd be nice if you could show exposure to Machine Learning techniques, NLP, Text Mining and ETL.If the role looks of interest, get in touch with Jack Leeming @ Optima Dev for a chat.

Description: IntroductionIntroduction ‚Äì Job MissionThe intern will be responsible for applied R&D in the areas of physical modeling, calibration and machine learning.This position may require access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R.730, et seq.). Title: Data Analyst
Description: This is a remote position.Walker Bowen Talent Partners, a trusted advisor in the permanent placement staffing industry, has partnered with a growing technology company in the travel industry whose technology ensures people travel better and are never taken advantage of. This is an exciting opportunity for entrepreneurial minded Data Analysts who also have a passion for travel!EnvironmentFast-paced, growing environment (but with stability and work-life balance!)Small team delivering rock solid functionality and performanceBuilding a beautiful consumer website by developing sophisticated algorithms and highly available systems to offer best in class services to our customersFully Remote / Distributed TeamMust be available to work 4-6 hour overlap of core hours (12noon-4pm EST)PositionOur client‚Äôs technical team is made up of hard-working engineers that share a common interest in building a beautiful consumer website by developing sophisticated algorithms and highly available systems to offer best in class services to our customers.You‚Äôll work with a large variety of data and information sources to look for trends and lead the charge in keeping us a data-driven company.You'll have 2-5 years' recent professional experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst and not be afraid of large, unstructured data sets. You'll be highly analytic with a strong background in mathematics and statistics. Experience with machine-learning and research is also a plus. Our client's proprietary algorithm crawls the many hidden corners of the Internet, including those hard-to-search airline award websites, to discover the clearest path to maximizing the value of loyalty and credit card points.Your work will impact the way rewards points are maximized, and help people travel better!What You'll DoCollect and process data from a variety of structured and unstructured data setsAnalyze travel data and information to discover trends and deliver insightsCollaborate with our product development and engineering teams to help solve business challenges and improve operationsBuild models, dashboards, and reports to improve decision making processes and lead effective product development strategyProvide real-time insights into customer habits, reward availability, and travel trends across the airline and credit card rewards industryHelp scale the fastest, smartest, rewards travel search engineRequirements Who You Are2-5 years' recent professional experience as a Data Scientist or Data AnalystExperience in data mining and understanding of machine-learning and operations researchAWS, Google Analytics, Google Data StudioAnalytical mind, business acumen, and strong background in mathematics and statistics Experience using business intelligence tools and data frameworksCompleted BSc/BA or Masters in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or relevant fieldA communicative person that values building strong relationships and even stronger teamsDetail-oriented and well organized, able to explain complex topics in a clear wayPassionate about developing amazing user experiences Company Tech Stack:Next.js, Vercel, Node.js, Java (Spring Boot) JavaScript, Tailwind, React, Angular Microservices, REST APIs Docker, Nginx, Postgresql AWS - EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, IAM Figma, Storybook, Shortcut, Slack, Google Workspace Gitlab, Github, Gradle, Jib, IntelliJ IDEA, CI/CD Firebase, Auth0, Braintree, Stripe, Hubspot Linux, Windows, MacAll Employees Are Offered The FollowingBenefits Our client believes in taking care of their team, so that their team can take care of their customers.Competitive salaries and meaningful equityComprehensive health care coverageA 100% distributed workforce, so you can contribute from wherever you preferAll candidates must be able to be employed in the US on a W2 basis, regardless of ultimate work locationAn open vacation policy, with a minimum of 15 days off each yearTeam trips and outingsThe anticipated salary range is $75k to $120k; specific compensation will be determined based on your level of experience.Given the nature of our client's business, they anticipate that all team members will be traveling from time to time, including company trips and off-sites, or meeting with strategic partners. As such, being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment. You'll be asked to provide a copy of your vaccination card in advance of your first day.

Title: AI / Machine learning specialist/researcher
Description: About UsStarted as an app to create floor plans and interior designs, Planner 5D is now a unified destination for home improvement and design for over 80+ million users across the globe.Do you remember the last time you were doing a renovation at home? Dealing with different designers and architects, figuring out where to place your furniture and how many outlets do you need. Our mission is to make the entire design process as streamlined and pleasant as possible. Planner 5D makes it possible for every person out there to design their own dream home ‚Äî and this is only the beginning of our path.Planner 5D is available on all platforms, including Web, iOS, Android, Windows and MacOS with full synchronization between them. The company is well funded by international VCs.Planner 5D is more than an app or a platform for home design. Planner 5D is a team. A team of perspective talents, sharing the same passion and values an opportunity to work together. A team of young enthusiasts, working from different countries and time zones to achieve a common goal. A team of highly-motivated professionals, seeking to make visual home design tools accessible to anyone.We strive to develop and enter new market verticals. That's why we are constantly searching for new talents and ready to expand our team.We are searching for AI / Machine learning specialist / scientist who will join our AI team and work on new exciting solutions like 3D point cloud understanding, 2D image recognition.What You Will DoResearch into fields of AI and mathematics to find solutions to not so easy real world problems, create prototypes and / or final solutions.Only reading papers and applying solutions from web will not be enough. In quite some cases you will have to create custom solutions or implement them from papers directly or explain to developers how to do it.RequirementsDeep understanding of AI, computer vision, statistics, geometry and topology, combinatorics (especially graph theory), analysis, optimizationExperience in computer science with knowledge of algorithms and data structuresAt least 4 years in AI research or practiceRequired knowledge ofPython - and common maths / AI / statistics libraries (numpy, scipy, shapely, pandas, ...)TensorflowSupporting technologies - JSON, Git, ...2D / 3D computer graphicsHow 3D data works - point-clouds, meshes, ...Character requirementsShould like your jobGreat analytical skillsWish to learn, use and understand new ideas, algorithms, technologies, solutionsHas hobbies related to technologies (programming, micro-controllers, 3D printing, physics, mathematics, ...)Should be able to understand tasks, and express himself to others (essentially to properly communicate in our team)What we offer: Competitive salary ‚Äî we want our team members to be comfortable and are open to any discussions.- Freedom and responsibility in the role ‚Äî we won't stand behind you pushing to work. We trust our team enough to allow people to work on their own.- Budget for education and training ‚Äî we encourage our team members to study and are ready to cover training expenses. - An opportunity to work from Vilnius ofice or remotely from any place in the world.We hope that your application will be the beginning of a long-term and mutually beneficial relationship that goes beyond a job. Fill in the form and we'll get back to you within a working day!PI200202563

Title: Machine Learning Engineers (Berlin & Ho Chi Minh City)
Description: Retail Foundation is a startup that provides an all-in-one cloud solution for the e-commerce industry to capture, enrich, and distribute product content at scale. We use AI and workflow automation to help our customers improve their product information management. As a spin-off of a consulting firm, we already have a large e-commerce company as a customer.We are looking for 2 experienced Machine Learning Engineers (one in Berlin and another in Vietnam) to join our team and help us develop further our deep learning models for image processing and classification.TasksAs part of our Product and AI team, you will:Build, train, deploy and monitor machine learning models in production Build MLOps pipelines for machine learning workflows automationWork closely with the team to define solutions to concrete and diverse business use-casesWork with labeled as well as unstructured dataKeep an eye on the latest research and tools to increase the knowledge of the teamWork together with colleagues in Germany and VietnamRequirementsQualification:‚Äì You master at least one machine learning framework (Pytorch is strongly preferred, additional frameworks are a plus)‚Äì you can write production-quality code in Python‚Äì ideally, you have worked on multiple computer vision problems (especially classification and matting/segmentation).Experience ‚Äì You have experience with computer vision problems and deep learning pipelines, in particular in the context of image classification, object/character detection and recognition, and image segmentation in e-commerce domain. Collaboration ‚Äì You are a team player and have worked in cross-functional teams before; you bring new ideas and ensure best practices are applied at every step. Academic skills ‚Äì You are comfortable with reading research papers and evaluating their relevance to the use case at hand. Problem solving ‚Äì You keep a pragmatic approach and evaluate an array of solutions to a given issue: start simple and experiment. Organization ‚Äì You work in an iterative and structured approach, with a focus on value for the clients and the company. Languages ‚Äì You are fluent in English as we are an international team. Some German knowledge is a plus but not a requirement. You have the work right in either Germany or Vietnam. BenefitsFlat hierarchies and codetermination just as you would expect from a startupFlexible working hoursFlexible remote work policyGenerous vacation daysA nice, centrally located office space in Berlin or our modern office in Ho Chi Minh CityFor Berlin people: the opportunity to work in Vietnam at our second office in HCMC

Title: Research Data Scientist
Description: Position DescriptionThe Program in Islamic Law at Harvard Law School and its SHARIAsource Lab is looking for a researcher and data scientist/ software engineer in its Lab to imagine and build innovative digital tools that will chart the future of research in Islamic law and history. At the SHARIAsource Lab, and in collaboration with related initiatives, we design and advance web applications, AI/NLP tools, and related data science tools to accelerate research on available Islamic law texts at Harvard (open-access) and elsewhere (libraries, databases, individual researchers). Working in coordination with the Program and Lab director on each project, the Research Data Scientist will work actively to advance designated projects in line with our mission: to provide resources and promote research in the academic study of Islamic law, and to facilitate new insights in Islamic law and history with the use of data science tools.This individual will work independently yet collaboratively, to lead work on designated projects with a small but active team of staff and collaborative partners, and to conduct the technical and subject-matter research necessary to build systems and write research papers on their basis. To those ends, proficiency in back-end databases, web-application development, and NLP/ML is expected; our most common stack includes Python, Ruby, Mongo, SQL, Ruby, and Javascript; knowledge of Islamic studies or law and history, and of related right-to-left (RTL) languages, is highly desirable. A good design sense and user-centricity are important. Responsibilities will include teasing out hard problems, close knowledge of the technical and Islamic studies fields, and scoping and implementing products.As a Research Data Scientist, You Will Work closely with Program/Lab director and with external partners as needed to scope of projects and research needs, with opportunities to write papers on research outcomes  Independently manage projects and implement evolving requirements into a working suite of applications, in collaboration with other researchers and technical partners as needed  Supervise Lab students and outside developers to advance existing and new projects  Adapt and expand existing applications and create new software-based solutions, working with Lab director and research-users, to support the needs of research projects  Research, design, develop, test, document, and deploy new applications and extensions to existing applications‚Äîincluding cutting-edge research on or incorporation of related Islamic studies-relevant digital humanities (DH) tools using Arabic, Farsi, or other RTL languages  Develop appropriate unit tests, ensure QA, and further develop and adhere to coding standards and best practices for dev/ops in this emerging field  Assist in writing proposals and grants to secure funding for scaling or developing existing and new tools Basic Qualifications Minimum of two years‚Äô post-secondary education or relevant work experience We Are Looking For People Who HaveAdditional Qualifications and Skills MA or PhD or commensurate experience of at least 2 years in computer / data science applications, an MA or PhD in Islamic studies or a related field.  Professional experience with end-to-end development (front-end development, RESTful web services, Mongo and SQL database design and use, ML and NLP methods, as well as React, Redux, and other back-end technologies).  Experience working with Agile methodologies (continuous integration, unit testing, SCRUM).  Experience collaborating with research leadership and technical or research partners, sponsors, and end-users.  Prior experience in the development of search tools, information architecture, and digital humanities or scientific software. Additional InformationThis is a one year term appointment with potential for renewal subject to funding and departmental need.We regret that Harvard Law School is unable to provide visa sponsorship for staff positions.All offers to be made by HLS Human Resources.Be a part of excellence and leadership in legal education and scholarship at Harvard Law School. We are a community of talented people from diverse backgrounds, lived experiences, and perspectives, dedicated to advancing the cause of justice all over the‚ÄØworld. We value our differences and our diversity as a source of strength. We are committed to developing and inspiring our students and our workforce. Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you do it,‚ÄØ Harvard Law School ‚ÄØis a place where you can thrive.Job FunctionInformation Technology, ResearchLocationUSA - MA - CambridgeJob CodeI0757P Applications Professional IIISub-UnitDepartmentProgram in Islamic LawTime StatusFull-time Salary Grade 057Union00 - Non Union, Exempt or TemporaryPre-Employment ScreeningEducation, IdentityCommitment to Equity, Diversity, Inclusion, and BelongingHarvard University views equity, diversity, inclusion, and belonging as the pathway to achieving inclusive excellence and fostering a campus culture where everyone can thrive. We strive to create a community that draws upon the widest possible pool of talent to unify excellence and diversity while fully embracing individuals from varied backgrounds, cultures, races, identities, life experiences, perspectives, beliefs, and values.EEO StatementWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (TTS)
Description: If you are looking to join a collaborative, open, high impact team of researchers and engineers - this one's for you üëãYou can continue to read or watch the video below (https://share.synthesia.io/7b88e1c7-dc79-41a8-85ae-1aac57abf0d8)About The PositionWe are looking for a Senior ML Engineer with a passion for working on cutting edge problems that can help us create highly realistic, emotional and life-like synthetic humans through text-to-video. We are looking for an excellent engineer with outstanding coding skills in Python.üë©‚Äçüíº We are a group of more than 30 Engineers in the R&D department and you will have the opportunity to collaborate with multiple research teams across diverse areas, working directly with our founders - Prof. Lourdes Agapito and Prof. Matthias Niessner.üöÄIn this position, you'll be working at the heart of a dynamic R&D team solving challenging problems with the focus on exploring new product opportunities and bringing new capabilities to market for synthetic video. This would include:Research and development of new methods to create synthetic voices (text-to-speech). Building the data-sets and metadata required to model emotional and expressive human voice. Developing production quality software, our teams work "full stack" with the ability to deliver direct to product and impact the world. Taking ownership of the full ML lifecycle from concept, development, testing, validation to deployment. We have multiple roles available spanning audio / video synthesis, multiple-view performance capture, generative models of people and exploring product opportunities in synthetic video. Take a look through the profile to see if this could be you. üòéBasic RequirementsBackground in Computer Science or related fieldExtensive knowledge in machine learning and deep learning techniques3+ years and excellent coding skills in Python4+ years of experience developing and delivering Machine Learning solutions in various areasExcellent verbal and written communication skills in EnglishNote: The interview process includes a round of Tech Challenge where your deep learning and programming skills will be tested.
