Description: Passionn√©(e) par la Data et le Code, avec une forte app√©tence pour les d√©fis, ce stage est fait pour vous.Vous int√©grerez le Lab Lincoln et son √©quipe pluridisciplinaire qui vous encadrera et vous fera progresser durant vos 6 mois de stage.Projet : Identifier et localiser les diff√©rents √©l√©ments d'un document scann√©, stocker et structurer l'information.Les entreprises peuvent poss√©der un important patrimoine de document scann√©s. Leur exploitation est complexe, car leur qualit√© est variable et les outils de recherche informatiques sont tr√®s peu efficaces sur ce type d‚Äôinformation. Dans le but d‚Äôam√©liorer leur exploitation, il faut √™tre en mesure d‚Äôidentifier leur contenu, tant dans la forme que dans le fond. Les m√©thodes d‚ÄôOCR permettent d‚Äôextraire assez facilement le texte de ces documents, mais pas leur structure, et cela pr√©sente des complexit√©s pour les exploiter (recherche d‚Äôinformation, mise en correspondance de valeurs issues de tableaux ‚Ä¶).L‚Äôobjectif de ce stage est de construire un package python disposant de diff√©rentes fonctionnalit√©s d‚Äôextraction de structure de document, afin de construire un ensemble de m√©tadonn√©es au plus proche de la r√©alit√© du document. Afin de parvenir √† r√©aliser cet objectif, il faudra construire un pipeline de traitement adapt√© √† tout type de document. Les √©l√©ments importants de ce projet seront les suivants : Identification des diff√©rents √©l√©ments dans un document : tableaux, figures, signatures, pagination‚Ä¶Veille technique et m√©thodologique en lien avec la probl√©matiqueChoix des outils et algorithmes adapt√©sLabellisation des donn√©esImpl√©mentation et validation des algorithmesConstruction des pipelines de traitementRefactoring et packaging des codesUn ensemble de plusieurs centaines de documents (contenant plusieurs pages) de contenus vari√©s sera mis √† disposition pour mettre en place et √©valuer les performances des traitements impl√©ment√©s.Vous serez amen√©(e) √† travailler dans le cloud (Azure). D√©roulement du stage :¬∑ Mise en place des environnements¬∑ Analyse et exploration de la base documentaire¬∑ Construction des objectifs du package (m√©thodologie + cible)¬∑ Mise en ≈ìuvre de la m√©thodologie (labellisation, entra√Ænement, √©valuation)¬∑ Packaging des codes, r√©daction de documentationAptitude, qualit√©s requises :¬∑ Curiosit√© et force de proposition¬∑ Int√©r√™t pour le domaine¬∑ Profil Ecole d'ing√©nieur¬∑ App√©tence pour les probl√©matiques Data Science. ¬∑ Bonne connaissance de la programmation en Python¬∑ Niveau d'anglais suffisant pour la compr√©hension d'articles scientifiquesUn stage r√©ussi d√©bouchera sur un CDI vous permettant d'int√©grer Lincoln et de participer au d√©veloppement de notre activit√© conseil en Data science.

Title: Healthcare Data Scientist
Description: LOCATION:  RemoteGeneral Statement Of JobThe Healthcare Data Scientist partners with stakeholders from all business units and related third parties to build a framework for population health analytics; analyze and make inferences from healthcare data; identify, lead and participate in predictive analytics projects; develop stratification algorithms and approaches for the organization; and provide advice to other teams for designing and building efficient infrastructure architectures for claims data analysis, data cleansing, data transformation, and data integration.The individual in this position must be highly motivated, meticulous, and detail-oriented. The incumbent will be instrumental in analyzing and making inferences from healthcare data and must be goal-oriented. He/she should have a background in healthcare ‚Äì preferably both behavioral and physical health ‚Äì as well as a strong background in statistics with some programming skills. Note:  This position requires access to and use of confidential healthcare information or protected health information (PHI) as described in laws addressing patient confidentiality, including, but not limited to, the federal HIPAA law, the Confidentiality of Alcohol and Substance Abuse Patient Records law, 42 CFR Part 2, and various state laws. As such, the individual filling this position shall be required to be trained regarding such laws and shall be required to observe those laws in his/her capacity as an employee of Vaya Health. The individual filling this position shall also sign a confidentiality statement as an employee of Vaya Health.Essential Job Functions Partner closely with the business leadership team to select business domain problems for analysis.  Perform meticulous and well thought-out analysis of healthcare data including the development, training, testing, and implementation of models for risk assignment, stratifying data, predicting values, and prescribing actions designed to create positive outcomes.  Perform meticulous and well thought-out analysis of financial data (including healthcare claims data) for fraud detection and to develop prescriptive algorithms for effective use of funds.  Detailed documentation of data analysis methods and presentation of results internally and externally.  Collaborate with the MIS development team and infrastructure teams to assist in architecting an infrastructure optimized for data analysis.  Assist in setting the strategy for organizing, hiring, training, and supporting other analysts as the company expands into greater population health and financial risk management analytics.  Other duties as may be assigned by the Enterprise Analytics Director or other Vaya management. Qualifications & Credentialing RequirementsMaster‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Epidemiology Public Health Data Science or related field with 5+ years of relevant experience in statistics, epidemiology, public health, data science, or a related field. Ph.D. is preferred.Physical Requirements Close visual acuity to perform activities such as preparation and analysis of documents; viewing a computer terminal; and extensive reading.  Physical activity in this position includes crouching, reaching, walking, talking, hearing and repetitive motion of hands, wrists and fingers.  Sedentary work with lifting requirements up to 10 pounds, sitting for extended periods of time.  Mental concentration is required in all aspects of work. Knowledge Of Job Strong healthcare knowledge; preferably clinical knowledge across behavioral, physical health, and pharmacy specialties. Advanced knowledge of applied statistics, optimization techniques, and study design and the ability to apply this knowledge to real-world healthcare business situations. Experience working with healthcare claims, pharmacy data, and electronic health record (EHR) data.  Proficiency in SQL (Microsoft T-SQL preferred) and R is required. Proficiency in Python is desirable.  High level of computer literacy with spreadsheets, word processing and database software and business systems (Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, VISIO, etc.).  Ability to work independently; demonstrated by developing, owning, and driving relevant, meaningful analysis with little guidance or input  Willingness to challenge established processes; extremely creative in using uncommon sources of data; conducting novel analyses; establishing new conventions  Proven problem solver, with the ability to understand complex processes and applications  Must possess the integrity and decision making skills necessary to work with and protect confidential personal health information.  Strong interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building  Excellent verbal and written communication skills; the ability to articulate ideas clearly and communicate strategically with senior leaders  SALARY:  Depending on qualifications & experience of candidate. This position is exempt and is not eligible for overtime compensation. DEADLINE FOR APPLICATION:  Open until filled APPLY:  Vaya Health accepts online applications in our Career Center, please visit http://www.vayahealth.com/careers-overview/ Ind.00 1Vaya Health is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Lead Data Scientist
Description: Who we are:Maltem Group is a community of 1,200+ passionate individuals dedicated to innovation, new technologies, data, and digital transformation projects.Founded in 2001 and located in 13 different countries, our footprint covers France, Singapore, Hong Kong, Philippines, Vietnam, Luxembourg, Belgium, Madagascar, Mauritius Island, Morocco, the US, Canada and Australia. Our expertise comprises 20 years of market knowledge in the business organisation, digital practices, agile, data management and innovation.Maltem Asia is a growing and multicultural data analytics, design and software engineering consulting boutique composed of highly experienced practitioners. We work closely with clients to understand, connect, improve organisational effectiveness, and deliver data value faster. We aim to support our partners in building a sustainable competitive advantage in their industry and be at the forefront of innovation and customer experience. About the Opportunity:We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist Lead to manage and drive analytics projects and co-initiate strategic initiatives with key stakeholders in the organisation, e.g. business, finance and senior management. This opportunity is to join the Data & Analytics team of one of our clients in the finance sector. Responsibilities:Build and implement advanced analytic solutions to provide actionable insightsEngage stakeholders, including senior management, to understand the needs, ability to articulate solutions/models clearly, seek buy-in and convince stakeholders why new processes/techniques should be adopted. Leverage data to drive/support decision making, identify the suitable techniques/solutions (e.g., AI/Machine Learning/NLP) to address business opportunities/challenges and implement them in production.Provide technical coaching and guidance to junior team members, levelling up data science knowledge to bring more excellent value to the companyStay abreast of industry developments, the latest modelling techniques, and/or frameworks.Qualifications :At least a Master's/Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or other related fields, preferably in machine learning, data mining and/or statistics. At least 5 years of data analytics experience in the industry (preferably in a B2B industry)Excellent modelling experience includes recommender, classification, clustering, deep learning and natural language processing. Familiar with handling time series data, machine learning framework and in-depth understanding of data processing and feature engineering techniques.Proficient in Python and SQL.Proven track record of deploying machine learning solutions into production environments and integrating them into operations.Ability to communicate complex models/analyses in layman's terms and work with C-suite stakeholders. Familiar with the machine learning product's development, deployment, production and operation life cycle. Able to think up innovative ideas to solve problems and challenges.Knowledge of modern data storage, such as KDB and/or Snowflake, will be a plusOur Recruitment Process: 1. Apply online! The HR team carefully studies your application within 3 to 5 days and contacts you if your profile matches one of our positions.2. First meeting! You discuss your background, professional aspirations, Maltem and the opportunities we offer with HR.3. Challenge yourself in a technical interview with one of our experts. It is also an opportunity for you to have his feedback.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description: IntroductionWe are looking for a talented (Senior) Data Scientist to help us fully leverage machine learning and deep learning models to drive product innovation.At Stepstone, we develop both innovative products that empower jobseekers in their career development and services that support recruiters to find the best talent for their challenges. As a (Senior) Data Scientist you will design experiments, test hypotheses and build models to support the continuous development of our products for both our candidates and recruiters.Do you hold advanced analytical skills and think in terms of hypotheses? Do you like to work with large data sets and want to shape the future of online sourcing? Are you eager to take on a big challenge? Then apply now!Equal opportunities are important to us. We believe that diversity and inclusion at StepStone is critical to our success as a global company so we want to recruit, develop and keep the best talent on the market. We encourage applications from everyone, regardless of your background, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, ethnicity, belief, age, family or parental status, and any other characteristic. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application or interviewing, please let us know.AufgabenYour WorkYou will identify, initiate, and drive data science solutions using a smart combination of data technologies and machine learning/AI methods to match job listings with candidates. Together with other data scientists and data engineers you will shape the intelligent eRecruiting infrastructure driving the success of Stepstone.You will be able to work on various modelling setups in both supervised and unsupervised settings (e.g. AI models, NLP in matching & search, nonlinear regression and classification problems, clustering, time series analysis, optimisation, etc.).You will take ownership of your projects end-to-end: you will not only build but also be involved in deploying your solutionsYou will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, other data scientists and data engineersYou will communicate back your results in a professional and actionable mannerYou will mentor and coach actively junior data profiles and share your data science expertise for ongoing projectsProfilYour ProfileYou have a master or PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Computer Science, etc.While we value academic experience, we are specifically looking for candidates who have at least 5 years of industry experience; experience in a Web-based technology company is regarded as a plusFamiliar with Python libraries used for Deep Learning tasks, eg, Tensorflow/Keras/PyTorch and deploy themFamiliar with advanced NLP application with Python, for example, Transformer models, GPT2, and so onExperience with ML Ops and with technologies like SageMaker, Docker or DVC is a plusExperience with model deployment through APIs is a plusYou have software development skills, and are familiar with GitYou are a team player who enjoys working in a collaborative, agile environmentYou have excellent communication skills with both technical and business audiencesYou are fluent in English (the working language)You are a German native speaker or have very good understanding of German (dataset of model is in German)Wir bietenYour teamYou will join an International team, located in Berlin, London, Brussels, & Warsaw and become an active part of our larger, international data science and data engineering community.We have backgrounds in different quantitative disciplines and share the conviction that the right combination of data, technology and smart algorithms is key and we all share one passion: to apply our expertise to improve e-recruiting.We are highly innovative, with an excellent track record of delivery. It's important for us to both have the freedom to explore ideas and to bring those ideas to life within a product.Our Values People - Building a company with diverse teams where talent from different backgrounds and culture can contribute, thrive, and flourish.Integrity - Being uncompromising and consistent in our commitment to integrity.Results - Driving results for everyone ‚Äì happy employees, happy customers, happy candidates and happy shareholders.Our environmentStepStone is a company with clear goals and visions. We focus on growth through innovative solutions, service quality, and qualified employees.From the very first day at StepStone you will be welcomed and supported by a cooperative team.Become a member of the data scientist chapter community to help you reach your goals with a personal career plan and trainings.Participate in workshops dedicated to innovation: get familiar with a new technology or try out a new idea!Join a dynamic workplace with flat structures, direct communication on first name basis from trainee to CEO, short distances, helpful and engaged colleagues and flexible working hours.Work in modern and attractive offices or from home.
